Compesnation

First month at 1USD per hour for trial period with conditional bonuses

50 Dollar Bonus per winning Ad



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

* Own the brand visual identity across website, ads,
, social, packaging, and content.

* Lead creative strategy for launches, promos, and campaigns.

* Direct photo shoots, video, UGC, and ad creatives.

* Work closely with performance marketing (PPC, paid social) to test and optimize creatives.

* Ensure creatives align with conversion goals (CTR, CVR, AOV).

* Set creative briefs, timelines, and quality standards for designers, editors, and creators.



QUALIFICATIONS

* Prior experience working with content creators, brands, or marketing teams is a plus.

* You must have experience editing short-form vertical videos for platforms such as TikTok, Instagram Reels, or YouTube Shorts.

* You must be able to edit using at least one of the following: CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, or DaVinci Resolve.

* You must understand pacing and hooks. You know that the first 1 to 3 seconds d
 whether people keep watching or scroll.

* You must be comfortable working completely from existing footage and from AI tools. This is an editing and repurposing role, not a filming role.

* You must be able to create clean subtitles and on-screen text in clear English.

* You must have a reliable computer and stable internet connection that can handle video editing work.

* You must have a strong sense of storytelling and visual flow, even in short-form content.

* You must be familiar with social media trends and understand what performs well on short-form platforms.

* You must be detail-oriented and able to follow brand guidelines and creative directions.

* You must be able to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines consistently.

* You must be open to feedback and able to revise edits efficiently.

* You must have basic knowledge of copyright rules and appropriate content usage.



WORK SCHEDULE AND SETUP

* You can set your own schedule as long as you consistently deliver your weekly output and can overlap at least 2 to 3 hours with US Eastern Time on agreed days for feedback calls or messages.

* You will use Slack for communication, Google Drive for assets and exports, and ClickUp or Notion for tasks. You will use your own editing software.



HOW TO APPLY

* OnlineJobs.ph subject line requirement:

Use this exact subject line when you apply:

CREATE - CREATIVE DIRECTOR



To apply for the Creative Director position, please include the following in the body of your application in plain text:

1. Short Introduction

Write a 3–5 sentence introduction about yourself. Include your experience with short-form video ads, creative strategy, and why a high-volume, repurposing-focused role is a good fit for you.



2. Portfolio / Work Samples

Provide 3–6 links to your best work. These should be vertical short-form videos (TikTok, Instagram Reels, or YouTube Shorts).

Ad-style edits are strongly preferred. If any of these achieved strong performance (views, engagement, or sales), please mention it.



3. Answer the Following Questions:

What editing software do you use daily?

How many 15–30 second ads can you realistically produce in one full working day while maintaining quality?

Have you worked with ecommerce, dropshipping, or DTC brands? If yes, briefly explain your role.

Have you used the TikTok Ad Library or Meta Ad Library to research or repurpose ads?

Are you comfortable with $150/month base pay + $50 USD per validated product, with an expected output of 80–100 ads per month?



4. Work Setup

Describe your computer setup, including CPU, RAM, and GPU (if applicable), and your internet speed. You may include a Speedtest result.



5. Optional (Strong Plus)

Submit a 1–2 minute Loom or unlisted YouTube video where you walk us through one ad you edited and explain your hook, pacing, and call to action.



Only applications that follow these instructions will be reviewed.

* Create 80–100 ads per month

 * Work only with existing assets: Product clips, b-roll, images, Competitor ads, Reviews & screenshots, AI-generated or AI-assisted clips

* Create multiple versions using: Different hooks (first 1–3 seconds), Different pacing, angles, and CTAs

* Add: Clear subtitles, On-screen text, Benefits, social proof, urgency

* Follow file naming and Google Drive structure

* Make fast revisions based on ad performance



4. REQUIREMENTS

* Experience editing short-form vertical videos

* Can use CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut, or DaVinci Resolve

* Understand hooks and fast pacing

* Comfortable working with existing footage only

* Can create clean English subtitles

* Reliable PC/laptop + stable internet



5. IDEAL TRAITS

* Detail-oriented

* Follows instructions well

* Can hit weekly output targets

* Open to feedback

* Looking for a long-term role, not a one-time gig



6. SCHEDULE & TOOLS

* Flexible schedule

* Must overlap 2–3 hours with US Eastern Time

* Tools used: Slack, Google Drive, 
, ClickUp, and Notion



7. HOW TO APPLY:

Use the exact subject line BLUE – Short-Form Ads Video Editor when applying. In your application, start with a short introduction of 3–5 sentences explaining who you are, your experience with short-form video ads, and why this high-volume editing role is a good fit for you. Include links to 3–6 samples of your vertical short-form ads (TikTok, Reels, or Shorts).



In the same message, clearly answer the following questions in plain text: what editing software you use daily, how many short-form ads you can realistically edit in one full working day, whether you have experience with ecommerce or dropshipping brands, whether you have used TikTok or Meta Ad Library to study or repurpose ads, and if you are comfortable with a compensation structure of $150 per month plus $50 per validated product.



Lastly, include your computer specifications (CPU, RAM, and GPU if applicable) and your internet speed. As an optional but strong plus, you may also share a 1–2 minute Loom or unlisted YouTube video where you explain one ad you edited and how you built the hook, middle, and call to action.



8. HIRING PROCESS

* Review applications (instructions must be followed)

* Shortlist based on portfolio & answers

* Paid test task

* 1-month paid trial

* Long-term role if successful

title: Administrative Support and Specialist
description:
We’re looking for an Administrative Agent to help support our sales and recruiting teams. This is an entry-level position that is eligible for promotion after 12 months of tenure.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********



You will fail the application process if you don't read the entire job description.



***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********

***********MAKE SURE YOU READ THE ENTIRE JOB DESCRIPTION********





About Us



Started in 2017, and we're growing like crazy.

We expect to hire at least 4 salespeople, 3 admins, and 3 marketers in 2026.

Growing FAST - We sold 2663 lessons in 2025, and we're on pace to sell 3328 lessons in 2026

A small team of 1 American and 10 Filipinos.

We sell manual transmission driving lessons in the United States. Yes, really.

100% inbound leads from Organic Search (SEO). We don’t do cold calling.

No competition - in 90% of the markets we serve, we have no competitors. Because of this, our sale is pretty easy to make.





Compensation and Benefits

Competitive commission package - $3.50 per hour

Paid 5 Sick Days - Effective on day 1

Paid 10 days vacation - Prorated

Paid 14 Bank holidays - (Legal and religious Holidays are country-specific)

Paid Birthday Off - you pick a day off

Business Continuity Plan - In cases of calamity $40 hotel accommodations are permitted to ensure work will continue



Type of Employment

Full Time

40 hours per week

Schedule - 9 AM to 5 PM EST



Benefits to be provided after completion of 3 months:

Health Insurance

Office equipment, home office furniture, and anything else you need for work

Learning books, courses, training, or coaching that you want



Benefits to be provided after completion of one year:

Paid two weeks off for the Christmas Season



Entry Level Details

Note that this is an entry-level job.

We do NOT expect you to have any prior sales experience.

If you’re looking to switch careers and get your foot in the door, this could be great for you.

This is a great opportunity for anyone with a background in any of the following areas: Customer Service, VA Admin, Admin Data Processing, Clerk,
 Communications, General VA, Admin Support, Sales and Admin Specialist, Administrative Support, Operations Admin, Executive Admin Assistant, Sales Assistant.





Duties and Responsibilities

New Orders - Processing Product Order (Gift Certificate)

New Orders - Initial Order Confirmation (Level 3)

Instructor Onboarding, Offboarding and Reonboarding

Reactivate Unavailable Instructor

Secret Message: When you apply, under the section that says "Is there anything else you'd like to write or include?", write the word PINK ELEPHANT. This will show us that you read the entire job description.

Duplicate Record Check

Updating the "Daily Tracking" Process

CTM Prospect Staging





Qualifications

At least 2-3 years of minimum work experience in a relevant or equivalent role

Comprehensive background in Customer and Administrative support

High level of accuracy and attention to detail

Excellent English communication and comprehension

Proficiency in using and managing Google applications - Gmail, Calendar, Documents, Drive

Preferably with knowledge in using cloud-based CRM

Organized and has careful attention to detail

Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively

Strong Problem-Solving skills

Customer Service Oriented and the ability to adapt/respond properly to different types of scenarios

Equipped with good skills in office/admin management, and can suggest process improvements

Must have your own computer, reliable high-speed internet, and a good quality headset and microphone.





What's Hard About This Job

Working Remotely - We're a remote-first company, and we never want to have an office. This is great if you like working by yourself in the quiet, but it can be terribly painful if you need the energy of coworkers nearby.

Our Cultural Values - We're an American company with an incredibly unusual culture. Even by American standards, our 7 cultural values are highly unusual. Our culture is challenging for people accustomed to corporate culture and especially difficult for people who grew up in Confucian cultures. It's a great culture for people who speak directly and have a great deal of self-confidence and ownership. If you identify as a misfit, you'll do well.

Multiple Software Systems - You're going to need to learn how to use 12 different software systems. This is great if you want to get exposed to and experience lots of technology, but it can be tough if you have a hard time learning technology. Secret Message - When you apply, you'll see a box that asks if you want to add anything else. Type in PINK ELEPHANT in all capital letters exactly as we've shown it here.





Cheat Code for getting a job with us:

1) Our application comprises the majority of our recruiting process. Because of that, we suggest that you give us thoughtful responses and rich stories. We typically only interview applicants who give rich and detailed answers to our questions. If you write short responses so that you can hurry up and finish the application, you will not get interviewed.

2) Tell us stories about how your actions match your beliefs and values. For example, if I say I value health and fitness, you don't know if I'm telling you the truth or if I'm just telling you what sounds good. But, if I tell you things I've done, I can illustrate my values of health and fitness with proof. For example, I go to the gym 4 days per week, I've done 6 triathlons, including an Ironman, and I can swim 3000 meters in one hour. My examples of things I've done prove that my actions match my values system.

3) Be vulnerable and honest. We take very detailed notes during the interview process, and we conduct extensive background checks. If the stories you tell about yourself don't match what your references say, we will not hire you. We'd rather hire a C student who is honest about being a C student than someone who is a C student but tries to pass themselves off as an A student. Remember, this is an entry-level job. We're not looking for perfect. We're looking for an excellent cultural fit.





How to apply: Please click on the link: 
/work-opportunities/administration-agent

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
Four Leaves Digital is a performance marketing agency operating in the UAE with clients in London and international markets.

We specialize in Google Ads, Meta Ads, SEO, and website development.



We are looking for a highly organized and proactive Full-Time Marketing Coordinator to work directly with the owner and support daily operations across clients and internal processes.



This is a full-time position. We will not entertain candidates who already hold another full-time or part-time job. Full commitment is required.



Key Responsibilities

1.
 Management – Manage the owner’s inbox, flag urgent matters, and organize
s efficiently.

2. Organization & File Management – Maintain client folders, billing files, and internal documents to ensure everything is structured and accessible.

3. Notion Task Management – Update tasks, add new tasks with proper tagging and assignment, and ensure follow-ups are tracked properly.

4. Meeting & Call Support – Attend calls, take detailed notes (using AI tools as support), convert discussions into actionable tasks, and assign them in Notion.

5. Monthly Media Planning & Reporting Coordination – Support the monthly planning and reporting process by coordinating with tea
mbers, updating sheets/reports, and ensuring deadlines are met.

6. Finance Coordination – Coordinate with accounting, prepare statements of account, issue invoices, and follow up on payments.

7. Client Contract Drafting – Draft client contracts using our existing process and templates. You will prepare the contract based on agreed terms, and the owner will conduct the final review before sending it to clients.



Who You Are

1. Highly organized and detail-oriented

2. Proactive and responsible

3. Comfortable managing multiple tasks

4. Good communicator and team player

5. Loves structure, systems, and keeping things moving



You will work closely with the owner and act as the operational support — the second brain and second set of eyes for the company.



Training will be provided.

title: Creative Ad Development, CRO and Media Buying Specialist Meta and Google
description:
Read This First





We are not looking for an ad button-pusher.



We are looking for one operator who can take full ownership of:

• Customer angles

• Creative direction

• Copywriting

• Competitor ad analysis

• Campaign setup, launch, and iteration



This starts as a paid trial using an existing store. dayflow.shop on a deliverable basis.

If you perform, this becomes long-term ownership across multiple brands with a 4 percent profit share ongoing. Performance upside is huge.



If you need:

• Hand-holding

• Preset SOPs

• Someone else to “approve everything”



Do not apply.



?



Context



We operate a branded wellness ecommerce store called Dayflow.

• 15–20 generic but validated wellness products

(massagers, eye masks, recovery tools, comfort products)

• Store is functional:

• Pages are acceptable

• Funnels work

• Traffic flows correctly



What’s missing:

• Sharp customer angles

• Strong creative leadership

• Cohesive messaging

• A single owner accountable for performance



This role exists to fix that gap.



?



Your Responsibility (End-to-End Ownership)



1. Full Store & Funnel Audit



You will independently:

• Audit the store end-to-end

• Identify:

• Messaging gaps

• Angle mismatches

• Product prioritization mistakes

• Conversion friction

• D
:

• What to keep

• What to change

• What to ignore



You will implement changes, not just suggest them.



?



2. Customer Angles & Positioning



You must:

• Define real buyer avatars

• Map:

• Pain ? mechanism ? outcome

• Assign specific angles to specific products

• Kill weak products or angles if needed



Generic “busy professionals / self-care” thinking will be rejected.



?



3. Creative Direction + Production



You fully own creative execution:

• Find and analyze competitor ads (Meta / TikTok)

• Either:

• Edit creatives yourself

• OR create clear creative briefs and hooks that convert

• D
:

• Hooks

• Formats

• Proof mechanisms

• CTA style



You may also 1 to 1 swipe the ads for testing



You do not need to film UGC,

but you must know how to direct it precisely.



?



4. Copywriting (Required)



You will write:

• Ad copy

• Primary text

• Headlines

• Angle-specific messaging



If you outsource copy in your process, do not apply.

We need someone who understands copy as part of the system, not a handoff.



?



5. Paid Ads Execution



You will:

• Set up clean testing structures

• Launch campaigns (Meta primary; TikTok optional bonus)

• Iterate based on signal

• Kill losers decisively

• Communicate performance clearly



This is operator logic, not dashboard theater.



?



What We’re Looking For (Non-Negotiable)

• Proven experience running DTC / dropshipping ads

• Strong creative intuition + analytical judgment

• Comfortable making decisions without approval loops

• Able to own results, not just tasks

• Clear communicator who can explain why something works or fails



?



What This Is NOT

• ? Not a beginner role

• ? Not “just media buying”

• ? Not a freelancer who waits for instructions

• ? Not someone who avoids accountability



If you’ve never been the final decision-maker on a store, this is not for you.



?



Trial ? Long-Term Path



This engagement begins as a paid trial on the existing Dayflow store.



If you demonstrate:

• Strong judgment

• Clean execution

• Creative leadership

• Performance improvement



You will be considered for:

• Long-term ownership of Dayflow

• Additional stores and budgets

• Expanded strategic role



?



How to Apply (Mandatory)



Applications without the following will be ignored.

1. Short intro (who you are, what you actually do)

2. 1–2 examples of brands/products you’ve owned end-to-end

3. Briefly explain:

• How you would audit a “working but underperforming” store

4. Answer this clearly (no fluff):



What usually kills stores that get traffic but don’t scale — and how do you personally fix it?



We care far more about thinking quality than credentials.

title: Shopify and Landing Page Builder for Dropshipping
description:
Full application here







About the role:

We’re looking for a landing page builder to help us quickly create and optimize conversion-focused pages for new e-commerce products.

We run a high-volume product testing model, typically testing 40–50 products. That means you’ll have many chances for “wins” and the associated $100 validation bonuses when your pages perform.

If you’re strong in Shopify/landing page builders, basic UX, and persuasive layout, this is a great opportunity for steady weekly income plus upside.



SOP







Compensation:



$10 USD per landing page built and approved (fixed weekly payment)



$100 USD bonus for every store that validates (details below)



Historically
a month retainer based on past validation numbers







Responsibilities:



Build simple, high-converting landing pages for single-product or small catalog e-commerce “stores”



Use our product briefs, angles, and references to structure pages that sell



Handle layout and structure (hero, benefits, social proof, FAQ, CTA sections, etc.)



Implement pages using no-code tools (for example: Shopify page builders like GemPages, PageFly, Shogun, or Webflow/other similar tools)



Collaborate with our team on iterations once we see early data



Ensure pages are mobile-first, fast-loading, and clean

Note: You will not be responsible for running ads or managing traffic. Your focus is building and refining landing pages/stores.

What “validation” means (how you earn the $100 bonus):



A store/landing page is considered validated when it hits both of the following during our testing window (usually the first 7–14 days after launch with paid traffic):



Sales threshold:



At least $1000 in tracked sales from cold traffic (excluding refunds and test orders)



Customer threshold:



At least 20 unique paying customers

When a store that you built meets these criteria during one of our test cycles, you earn a $100 USD bonus for that store, paid on top of your weekly $50.



Because we test 40–50 products, and you’ll be building for multiple products over time, there is a real opportunity to stack bonuses as more stores validate.



What we provide:



Clear product briefs (features, benefits, audience)



Reference sites and examples when available



Guidance on brand voice and style



A consistent pipeline of products to work on



Fast feedback based on performance data (what’s working / what isn’t)

Requirements (must-haves):



Proven experience building conversion-focused landing pages or e-commerce storefronts



Familiarity with at least one landing page or store builder (Shopify + GemPages/PageFly/Shogun, Webflow, or similar)



Strong grasp of layout, hierarchy, and clarity (you understand what makes a page easy to scan and buy from)



Ability to work from a brief and move quickly with minimal hand-holding



Reliable communication and consistent weekly delivery

Nice-to-haves:



Experience with DTC brands, dropshipping, or product testing environments



Basic understanding of CRO (A/B tests, above-the-fold design, scarcity, social proof)



Light copy-editing skills (comfortable polishing headlines and section text)

Time commitment and workflow:



Ongoing role with weekly work



Expect a few landing pages/stores per week, depending on product volume and your speed



We will start with a short test task (one landing page) to ensure mutual fit

Compensation summary:



Base: $50/week guaranteed, paid through Upwork



Bonus: $100 for each validated store you build (as defined above)



Upside: With 40–50 products in our testing pipeline, strong builders have many chances to hit multiple validations and bonuses over time

How to apply:

Please apply via these qustions and include:



A short introduction (1–2 paragraphs) about your landing page/e-commerce experience



3–5 examples of landing pages or stores you’ve built (links/portfolio)



What tools/page builders you are most comfortable with



Your approximate weekly availability (in hours) and your time zone



Compensation confirmation: Our structure is $50 USD per week base pay, plus a $100 USD bonus for every store you build that validates. Do you fully understand and agree to this compensation model?



Portfolio: Please share 3–5 links to landing pages or e-commerce stores you have personally built, and briefly describe your role in each.



Tools and stack: Which platforms and page builders are you most experienced with plus use of shrine (e.g., Shopify, GemPages, PageFly, Shogun, Webflow, etc.)? Please list them and indicate your proficiency level for each



Availability and speed: How many hours per week can you reliably commit, and how many simple product landing pages can you usually complete in a week?



Experience with testing and performance: Have you worked in a product testing or high-iteration environment before (e.g., testing many products or variations quickly)? If yes, describe your experience and how you used performance data to improve pages.



Deliverables

Build and optimize Shopify store

Design high-converting landing pages

Integrate payment gateways

Ensure mobile responsiveness

Optimize for SEO



If you do not answer these questions your application will not be considered.

title: Luxury Shopify Store Builder for Branded Wellness E-Commerce (DriveOn)
description:
Full application here







Long-Term Project | $50USD paid upon completion of each store | Filipino Applicants Only



ABOUT THE BRAND



DriveOn is a high-end wellness and performance brand focused on:



Recovery equipment



Mobility tools



Fitness and home gym accessories



Golf performance and biomechanics



Premium protocols and systems



Our standard is simple:

We operate like a luxury DTC brand, not a typical dropshipping store.

Everything must look and feel at the same level as Therabody, Hyperice, and Peloton.



We are building a full-scale Shopify website that reflects this brand identity and presents DriveOn as a premium authority in wellness and athletic performance.



ROLE OVERVIEW



We are hiring one highly skilled Shopify Store Builder who can execute a complete, premium, branded e-commerce build.



This role requires:



Strong Shopify implementation skills



Clear understanding of branded niche stores (not general stores)



Ability to follow a detailed specification document



High attention to detail



Professional, polished UI/UX standards



Strong communication and daily reporting



This is a project-based role with the potential for long-term work.



COMPENSATION



Rate: $3 per hour (fixed)

Hours: 90–120 hours total

Duration: 3–6 weeks

Work Setup: Remote (PH only)

Payment Frequency: Weekly via Wise or PayPal

Time Tracking Required: Yes (Toggl or Clockify)



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Shopify Theme & UX Implementation



Set up and configure the Shopify theme (Dawn or similar)



Implement luxury-tier branding (colors, fonts, spacing, layout)



Ensure clean, modern, high-conversion UI



Homepage & Site Architecture



Build a premium landing experience



Set up all pages: Home, About, FAQ, Contact, Legal, Policies



Configure collections and navigation for a branded niche store



Product & Bundle Build-Out



Upload and format 25–35 products



Create 4 main bundles using our brand framework



Optimize product pages for clarity, trust, and conversion



Apply proper SEO titles, descriptions, and structure



App Setup (Phase 1 Only)



Klaviyo setup (flows, list, segments – copy provided)



Product reviews app



AutoDS or CJ for fulfillment



FeedOps or AdNabu for Google Merchant Center



Lead capture app (Justuno/Privy)



Analytics & Feed Configuration



GA4 setup and event testing



Pixel install (Meta/TikTok if needed)



Google Merchant Center feed configuration



Quality Assurance



Test the full website on desktop and mobile



Validate checkout flow



Fix spacing, formatting, and UX inconsistencies



Ensure fast loading speeds



Documentation



Provide a final walk-through video



Deliver store credentials & system notes



Submit daily progress updates



REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE



You must meet all of the following requirements:



Technical Skills



Strong Shopify store-building experience



Ability to structure branded niche stores (not general stores)



Strong product page layout and UX formatting



Experience with theme customization (sections, blocks, minor Liquid edits)



Familiarity with Klaviyo setup



Experience with Google Merchant Center setup



Ability to optimize mobile layouts and spacing



Understanding of clean, modern UI/UX principles



Ability to follow detailed instructions precisely



Professional Qualities



Extremely detail-oriented



Communicates clearly in writing



Reliable with deadlines



Organized and proactive in problem-solving



Able to ask questions early



Delivers consistent daily updates



Does not disappear or delay timelines



REQUIRED DOCUMENT REVIEW (MUST READ BEFORE APPLYING)



You must read the official DriveOn Shopify Build Specification before applying.



DriveOn Shopify Build Specification (Google Doc):





Applicants who do NOT reference something specific from this document will not be considered.



WHAT THIS ROLE IS NOT



Not a general store build



Not a simple template installation



Not a beginner project



Not for applicants who cannot follow strict branding rules



Not for people who rely on AI to generate full pages



Not for those with poor communication or inconsistent availability



This role requires precision and professionalism.



DAILY COMMUNICATION REQUIREMENT



You must send a daily update using the format below:



Today’s Progress:



What you completed



In Progress:



What you’re working on next



Questions/Blockers:



Anything you need help with



Next Steps:



What you will do tomorrow



HOW TO APPLY



Your application must include all of the following:



Subject Line:

Luxury Shopify Store Builder – DriveOn



Your Message (include all items below):



Years of Shopify experience



Number of Shopify stores you have built



Links to 2–3 Shopify stores you personally built



Your strongest Shopify skills



Experience with Klaviyo



Experience with Google Merchant Center



Experience building branded niche stores



One detail from the DriveOn Specification Document that stood out to you (to confirm you read it)



Confirmation you agree to $3/hr



Confirmation you can send daily updates



Confirmation you can start immediately



Optional (strongly preferred):



Portfolio or screenshots of your best Shopify work



Any UX/UI strengths you bring



Applicants who fail to follow instructions will not be considered.



FINAL NOTE

Full-Time (40 hours/week)

U.S. Mountain Time schedule

description:

Overview

High-end real estate property videos

Builder & construction showcases

Architectural features & design storytelling

Promotional brand edits for businesses

Key Responsibilities

Real Estate, Construction & Promo Editing

Edit cinematic, high-impact property videos showcasing interiors, exteriors, lifestyle elements, architecture, and land features

Build fast-turnaround construction progress videos, promo reels, project showcases, and brand storytelling pieces

Creative Execution & Collaboration

Work from raw media and briefs to produce polished, broadcast-level edits

Take constructive criticism without ego — improve, iterate, and refine

Work efficiently under pressure, meeting tight deadlines and high-volume demands

Communicate clearly with our internal team and clients across review cycles



Optional but Preferred

Ability to design static promotional assets (carousels, quotes, graphic posts)

Strong understanding of brand identity and visual strategy



Portfolio Requirements

Submit 10–15 examples of:

Real estate, construction, or architectural video edits

Promotional commercial edits

Short-form vertical content (Reels, Shorts, TikTok)

(Optional) Static design work

Requirements

Minimum 3–5+ years professional experience in real estate/construction/promotional editing

Strong understanding of modern pacing, visual hooks, retention strategy, and commercial storytelling

Ability to work fast without compromising quality

Willingness to learn, grow, adapt — no ego

Availability during Australian Eastern Time working hours

Additional Preferences

Strong colour grading ability

Understanding of real estate marketing strategy

Familiarity with aerial/drone workflow

Ability to contribute ideas to improve visual strategy



Benefits

Competitive pay based on expertise

Flexible working structure

Long-term, consistent work

High-level creative environment with room to grow



How to Apply

Submit:

Resume

Short cover letter

A portfolio with required samples

Your average editing times per content type

Use the application code VIDDY so we know you’ve read the full role description.



IMPORTANT: This is an expert-only position. You will be skills-tested.

If you’re not proven, not fast, or not world-class — this isn’t for you.

title: Youtube Editor - Davinci, Fusion, After Effects
description:
Looking for an editor to create engaging YouTube video from surf and travel footage. You'll be working with cinematic footage or just lifestyle footage .You can either create a cinematic video that focuses on clear type hierarchy, or a story driven video that uses lots of sound cues and effects. I’ve attached examples of both styles, and you will choose one of these styles for your video. ONLY APPLY if you can actually produce any of these 1. the train animation?
 

2. the timeline animation?

3.the map 



Someone who understands type hierarchy + sound cue

Responsibilities:

* Add captions, text overlays, and sfx

* Match my existing aesthetic (cinematic, clean, story-driven)

* Quick turnaround -  once per week ( ideally in 3 days)

Ideal if you have experience with travel/surf content and understand YouTube sfx cue



TO APPLY, PLEASE INCLUDE:

1. A link to 1 longform or 3 short-form videos you edited that show your EFFECTS work (stickers, animations, sound design — not just cuts and transitions)

2. Which software you use (Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve)

3. How long it typically takes you to add effects to 10-20 min video

4. Your timezone and weekly availability

5. Your honest assessment — are you stronger at effects/motion graphics, sound design, full editing, or equally?

This is long-term, consistent weekly work. I pay on time every week via the platform.





Details:

Our company is based in (PST timezone) looking for a skilled short-form video editor. This is ongoing weekly work — consistent schedule, consistent pay.

THERE ARE TWO TYPES OF ASSIGNMENTS:

Type A — Effects Only (most common): I send you a finished rough-cut MP4 (10 to 20 minutes). Your job is to add effects ON TOP of my edit. You are welcome to trim or re-cut sections if it improves pacing for the effects you're adding.

Type B — Full Edit (occasional): I send you raw footage and a script/notes. You do the full edit from scratch — cuts, pacing, effects, sound design, everything.



WHAT YOU'LL ADD TO EACH VIDEO:

* Animated stickers, GIFs, emoji reactions, and text that appear to keep viewers engaged

* Custom mini-animations (Example: a cartoon emoji of my head moving across an animated map from city A to city B)

* Sound effects that match the energy of each 
nt (whooshes, pops, dings, boings, scary soundetc.)

* Occasional zoom-ins, shake effects, split-screen, and dynamic transitions

* You do NOT add commercial background music — I handle that myself

WHAT YOU SEND BACK:

For every video, you upload to our shared dropbox folder:

1. The project file (.prproj for Premiere or .drp for DaVinci Resolve + timeline file)

2. A media folder with ALL assets you used (GIFs, stickers, PNGs, sound effect files)

3. An exported MP4 preview draft

I then open your project file, do my final pass (tweak timing, adjust effects, add music if needed), and export the final version myself.

REQUIREMENT: You MUST use either Adobe Premiere Pro + After Effects, OR DaVinci Resolve + Fusion. We need to work in the same software so I can open and edit your timeline directly.

If you have questions, message me — I typically reply within a few hours during California business hours (which is your late evening / early morning).

WHAT I'M LOOKING FOR:

* Strong portfolio showing effects and motion graphics/sound design work on short-form content (TikTok, Reels, Shorts style) — not just basic cuts

* Owns and is proficient in DaVinci Resolve + Fusion or Premiere Pro + After Effects

* Reliable internet for uploading and downloading project files via dropbox

* Responsive communication

* Creative ,you suggest effects and ideas, not just wait for instructions

title: Customer Service Consultant (Work-from-Home)
description:
ABOUT US



We are a purpose-driven service company committed to assisting individuals through one of life’s most challenging times. At SuperCare, we believe that health and well-being should always come first. As a pioneering Australian company, we empower eligible individuals to access essential medical treatments by facilitating the early release of their Superannuation on compassionate grounds. For over a decade, we have been making a meaningful impact, helping thousands ease their financial burdens while prioritising their health.



With offices strategically located in Sydney and Canberra, we provide nationwide support to ensure our clients receive the care they need, wherever they are. As industry leader, we are committed to continuous innovation, delivering exceptional client experiences, and fostering a workplace culture that promotes professional growth and collaboration.



As we continue to grow, we are excited to invite an experienced and highly competent Customer Service Consultant to help with our mission of transforming lives.







THE ROLE



The Customer Service Consultant plays a pivotal role in ensuring client satisfaction and engagement. Responsible for managing a portfolio of assigned clients though each stage of the application process for the early release of Superannuation due to compassionate grounds. Ensure a seamless client experience through every touch point. Provide expert-level support to our clients, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and going above and beyond to exceed expectations.



As a dedicated consultant, serve as the primary contact in addressing all client inquiries and concerns. Take ownership and accountable for a sustainable high level of performance in critical areas of (1) Client Engagement and (2) Service Delivery.

title: Video Editor — Effects + Full Edits (DaVinci Resolve or Premiere/Aftereffect)
description:
Looking for an editor to create engaging shortform content (Reels, TikTok, YouTube Shorts) from surf and travel footage. You'll be working with cinematic footage or just lifestyle footage .You can either create a cinematic video that focuses on clear type hierarchy, or a story driven video that uses lots of sound cues and effects. I’ve attached examples of both styles, and you will choose one of these styles for your video. ONLY APPLY if you can actually produce any of these 



Someone who understands type hierarchy + sound cue 

Responsibilities:

* Edit raw footage into 30-90 second vertical videos

* Add captions, text overlays, and trending audio

* Match my existing aesthetic (cinematic, clean, story-driven)

* Quick turnaround (2-3 days per video)

Ideal if you have experience with travel/surf content and understand YouTube Shorts + Instagram algorithm trends.



TO APPLY, PLEASE INCLUDE:

1. A link to 3 short-form videos you edited that show your EFFECTS work (stickers, animations, sound design — not just cuts and transitions)

2. Which software you use (Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve)

3. How long it typically takes you to add effects to one 60 to 90 second video

4. How long it typically takes you to do a full edit of a 60 to 90 second video from raw footage

5. Your timezone and weekly availability

6. Your honest assessment — are you stronger at effects/motion graphics, sound design, full editing, or equally?

This is long-term, consistent weekly work. I pay on time every week via the platform. 





Details: 

Our company is based in (PST timezone) looking for a skilled short-form video editor. This is ongoing weekly work — consistent schedule, consistent pay.

THERE ARE TWO TYPES OF ASSIGNMENTS:

Type A — Effects Only (most common): I send you a finished rough-cut MP4 (1 to 1.5 minutes). Your job is to add effects ON TOP of my edit. You are welcome to trim or re-cut sections if it improves pacing for the effects you're adding.

Type B — Full Edit (occasional): I send you raw footage and a script/notes. You do the full edit from scratch — cuts, pacing, effects, sound design, everything.

Both types are paid hourly at $6/hour. Effects-only videos typically take 1.5 to 2.5 hours. Full edits typically take 3 to 5 hours. I track hours through the platform.

WHAT YOU'LL ADD TO EACH VIDEO:

* Animated stickers, GIFs, emoji reactions, and text that appear every 2 to 3 seconds to keep viewers engaged

* Custom mini-animations (Example: a cartoon emoji of my head moving across an animated map from city A to city B)

* Sound effects that match the energy of each 
nt (whooshes, pops, dings, boings, scary soundetc.)

* Occasional zoom-ins, shake effects, split-screen, and dynamic transitions

* You do NOT add commercial background music — I handle that myself

WHAT YOU SEND BACK:

For every video, you upload to our shared dropbox folder:

1. The project file (.prproj for Premiere or .drp for DaVinci Resolve)

2. A media folder with ALL assets you used (GIFs, stickers, PNGs, sound effect files)

3. An exported MP4 preview draft

I then open your project file, do my final pass (tweak timing, adjust effects, add music if needed), and export the final version myself.

REQUIREMENT: You MUST use either Adobe Premiere Pro + After Effects, OR DaVinci Resolve + Fusion. We need to work in the same software so I can open and edit your timeline directly.

WEEKLY SCHEDULE AND TURNAROUND:

I upload 5 videos every Friday (PST). In Manila time, you will see the files Saturday morning.

Your deadline: Wednesday 6 PM Manila time (all 5 videos delivered). That gives you Saturday, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday — 5 full days.

Deliver each video rolling as you finish it (don't hold all 5 until Wednesday). This way I can start reviewing early.

You are completely free from my work Thursday and Friday every week. You can take other clients those days.

COMMUNICATION:

All deadlines are in Manila time so there is no confusion. I will leave notes for each video in a shared Google Doc or in the dropbox folder. If you have questions, message me — I typically reply within a few hours during California business hours (which is your late evening / early morning).

WHAT I'M LOOKING FOR:

* Strong portfolio showing effects and motion graphics/sound design work on short-form content (TikTok, Reels, Shorts style) — not just basic cuts

* Owns and is proficient in DaVinci Resolve + Fusion or Premiere Pro + After Effects 

* Reliable internet for uploading and downloading project files via dropbox

* Can commit to this weekly schedule consistently

* Responsive communication

* Creative ,you suggest effects and ideas, not just wait for instructions

title: Operations Manager (Remote – Full Time, Australian Healthcare Business)
description:
About Us



We are a fast-growing Australian telehealth business operating nationally.



As we enter our next growth phase, we are building stronger operational foundations. We are seeking a highly organised, systems-focused Operations Manager to work directly with the CEO to strengthen structure, accountability, and execution across the business.



This is a senior remote role with direct exposure to leadership and company-wide impact.



The Role



This is not an assistant position. This is a hands-on operational leadership role responsible for ensuring the business runs efficiently, predictably, and with clear accountability.



You will be responsible for:



Operations & Systems



Identifying operational inefficiencies and driving improvements

Creating and maintaining KPI dashboards and reporting frameworks

Supporting cross-department execution

Scheduling & Workforce Management

Managing practitioner and team schedules

Managing leave, coverage, and roster adjustments

Ensuring consistent 5-day operational coverage

Monitoring productivity and utilisation metrics

Customer Support & Revenue Support

Monitoring customer service quality and response times

Implementing QA and call review processes

Supporting conversion optimisation within customer support

Managing escalations professionally and calmly

HR & Administration

Maintaining HR documentation and contracts

Overseeing on boarding processes

Supporting recruitment coordination

Mapping and maintaining operational workflows (L
 or similar)

Ensuring SOP's are clearly documented, version-controlled, and implemented

Experienced with google suite and CRM's

Ensuring policies are documented and followed



What We Are Looking For



You are:



Highly detail-oriented and structured

Strong in written and spoken English (professional level)

Calm, emotionally steady, and solution-focused

Systems-minded 

Comfortable holding people accountable respectfully

Confident working directly with a CEO

Comfortable working in a fast-moving environment



You must have:



3+ years experience in operations management, project management, or similar

People management experience

Experience building or improving operational systems

Strong Google Workspace proficiency

Experience managing schedules or workforce coordination

Experience working with Western/Australian businesses preferred

Healthcare experience is a bonus but not required.

We are looking for someone who wants to grow into a long-term leadership role within a scaling business.



Hours



Full-time

Must align with Australian (Sydney) business hours.



To Apply



Please include:

A short 2–3 minute video introducing yourself

CV

A summary of your operations experience

A specific example of a system you improved (before/after)

Your internet speed test

Software's you have experience with

Confirmation you can work Australian hours



Applications without these will not be reviewed.

What You’ll Get:

Ready to join a high-performance team?

title: World's Greatest VA for the World's Greatest Salsa School
description:
We are Toronto Dance Salsa, Canada’s largest Salsa dance school. Our vision is to solve the world’s greatest problem: lonliness. For over 10 years, we’ve been building a community where people feel they belong. We believe in creating a tribe you choose, not just the family you’re born into. Do you want to help make this vision real? If you’re eagre to do purposeful work and grow both professionally and personally, you may have found your new HOME. This isn’t just a job, it’s an opportunity to learn how to make an impact. In your application, please put “I am your next awesome Virtual Assistant!” in the subject line. The job responsibilities include administrative and techincal support, answering
s from students and making them feel welcomed, managing logistics and staying organized, and being proactive in improving role efficiency and suggesting business improvements. The ideal candidate is detail oriented, has excellent English skills, technical proficiency, customer support experience, and reliable equipment. Please also include the link to your resume, your hourly salary expectations, your ideal work schedule, and in the first line of your message list any spelling or grammatical errors you found in this job post. We have to change one of our weekly classes, so please calculate the new Sunday schedule for a 6 week course by moving the start date later by 3 weeks. Current 2024 schedule: June 9 to July 21, with no class on June 30. Rules: we do not run classes on Ontario statutory holidays, and if a holiday lands on a Friday or Monday, we take that whole weekend off. In your application, include the full list of the 6 new Sunday class dates in order, and please watch this Loom video: 
 
 job is full time (40 hours per week) with the opportunity to transition into a long term role, would start immediately, and is ongoing. We would start with a small project first, and we’d pay you for your ideas and research. Be part of a team that’s changing people’s lives. Thank you for considering joining our mission to solve lonliness. We look forward to possibly having you feel like you belong at our school as well. Please submit your job application only via OnlineJobs.ph. Do not send your application message. Irish #Belong

title: Marketing Activation Lead / B2B Marketing Manager
description:
Responsibilities:

* Lead the activation and launch of new pet brands and products, managing multiple launches each year across US retail and online marketplaces such as Amazon and Chewy.

* Plan and deliver digital first promotional strategies that drive rate of sale, off take, and brand visibility, with clear measures of success.

* Partner with product development and brand teams from ideation through development, sharing market feedback and activation insight that shape launch decisions.

* Own the coordination of retail marketing, trade promotions, and digital campaigns, aligning plans with commercial goals and inventory realities.

* Track and report on campaign performance, using data to refine tactics and improve results over time.

* Work closely with external agencies and partners across the US and other markets to deliver strong, well executed activations.

* Help evolve Pet Foundry’s marketing playbook by bringing new ideas, testing approaches, and pushing how pet brands show up in market.



Requirements:

* Strong FMCG marketing background across brand, product, or trade, with an appetite for a more hands-on, early-stage environment.

* A start-up mindset, willing to test ideas, adjust quickly, work through ambiguity and balance speed with discipline.

* Proven ability to plan and execute product launches and promotions with clear commercial outcomes.

* Experience working closely with retail or distribution partners to deliver effective in channel activation.

* Solid understanding of digital marketing fundamentals, with hands on exposure to paid media and performance measurement.

* Commercially grounded, using data and insight to guide decisions and refine execution.

* Comfortable operating in environments where pragmatism matters and resources require careful prioritisation.

* Collaborative and clear in communication, able to work across teams and influence stakeholders.

* Adaptable and resilient, able to manage shifting priorities and learn from what works in market.

* Curious about improving how things are done, with a practical approach to challenging category conventions.

title: Operations Manager
description:
Role Purpose:

Manage and execute day-to-day operations across OEM and re-pack partners in China and Thailand, supporting product development, inventory flow, S&OP execution, and logistics. The role is highly hands-on and suited to someone who thrives on operational detail and execution.

  

Responsibilities:

- Manage OEM and re-pack manufacturing partners and production schedules?- Support new product development from an operations perspective, including samples and pilots?- Execute inventory planning and replenishment?- Support and execute S&OP plans?- Coordinate international logistics, freight bookings, and documentation?- Track cost, service, and delivery performance?- Maintain operational dashboards and reporting



Operating Style & Expectations:

This is a small, lean team. The Operations Manager must be comfortable taking full ownership of execution, working directly with suppliers, freight partners, and internal stakeholders. The role requires proactivity, resilience, and comfort operating without large support teams.



Requirements:

- 4–8 years in operations, supply chain, or manufacturing?- Experience working with international OEMs and logistics providers?- Exposure to Asia sourcing preferred?- Highly organised, detail-driven, and execution-focused?- Comfortable working across time zones and culture

title: Head of Operations
description:
Role Purpose:

Own and scale the end-to-end operations platform across Asia (China- and Thailand-centric), covering OEM sourcing, re-pack manufacturing, product development input, inventory, S&OP, and logistics. While this is a senior role, the Head of Operations is expected to remain highly hands-on and execution-oriented, particularly during early-stage setup and scale.

  

Responsibilities:

- Define and own OEM and re-pack manufacturing strategy across China and Thailand?- Source, qualify, contract, and manage manufacturing partners?- Act as operations lead within product development, ensuring feasibility, cost, MOQ, and scalability?- Lead inventory strategy, working capital optimisation, and service-level planning?- Own and run the S&OP process?- Oversee inbound and outbound logistics and landed cost optimisation?- Implement SOPs, KPIs, and operational governance?- Ensure quality, food safety, and regulatory compliance



Operating Style & Expectations:

This is a small-team environment. The Head of Operations must be comfortable operating as both architect and executor, personally driving supplier conversations, solving day-to-day issues, and building processes from first principles. There is limited delegation in the early phases; success depends on personal ownership and bias to action.



Requirements:

- 10+ years in operations, supply chain, or manufacturing leadership?- Deep experience with Asia-based OEM manufacturing (China and/or Thailand essential)?- Experience scaling outsourced manufacturing models?- Strong commercial and cost mindset?- Comfortable operating in ambiguous, fast-moving environments

title: Graphic Designer and Video Editor, Ecommerce and Performance Creative
description:
Role Overview

We are looking for a fast moving, trend aware Graphic Designer and Video Editor to support our ecommerce fashion brands. This is a high pace execution role where speed, relevance, and consistent output are essential. The ideal candidate understands both static and video performance creatives and knows how to design assets that stop the scroll and drive action.



You will work closely with our remote team to execute marketing briefs across ads, social media, ecommerce listings, and website campaigns. This role requires a strong sense of visual storytelling, performance awareness, and the ability to produce multiple creative variations quickly.



Key Responsibilities



Video and Performance Creative

 1. Create fast turnaround fashion focused product and lifestyle videos for ecommerce listings and paid ads.

 2. Develop short form, trend driven video creatives for
, Instagram, and TikTok.

 3. Generate or enhance video content using AI tools when raw footage is limited or unavailable.

 4. Produce multiple creative variations from the same concept to test different hooks, angles, and formats.

 5. Optimize videos for performance including strong hooks, pacing, captions, framing, and transitions.

 6. Export platform ready videos in multiple aspect ratios and resolutions for rapid testing.



Graphic Design and Visual Creative

 1. Design marketing creatives for ads, campaigns, social media, and promotional launches.

 2. Support product image design and simple visual enhancements when required.

 3. Create brand consistent graphics for website banners, landing pages, and promotional sections.

 4. Translate briefs into effective visual concepts and polished final designs.

 5. Implement feedback efficiently and deliver revisions within agreed timelines.

 6. Deliver final files in required formats for ecommerce and paid media use.



Performance Understanding

You should understand core performance metrics such as hook rate, hold rate, watch time, and creative fatigue. You must be able to apply these insights to improve both video and static creatives.



Required Skills and Experience

 1. Proven experience working with ecommerce or DTC brands.

 2. Strong portfolio demonstrating both digital design and video editing work.

 3. Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, After Effects, Figma, or similar tools.

 4. Strong command of layout, typography, color, visual hierarchy, and motion pacing.

 5. High proficiency with AI tools for image generation, enhancement, and video augmentation.

 6. Ability to work independently in a fast paced environment with clear communication.



Preferred

Experience in fashion, luxury, or lifestyle ecommerce brands.

Experience producing high volume ad creatives for paid media testing.



Engagement Details

Freelance or contract based role.

Remote work.

Opportunity for long term collaboration based on performance.



Deliverables

Design campaign creatives tailored for ecommerce platforms.

Produce product and lifestyle videos optimized for paid ads.

Deliver AI generated or AI enhanced visuals when required.

Create multiple variations for testing different hooks and formats.

Provide product and website visual assets for digital use.

title: Sales Manager
description:
GoHibachi — SALES MANAGER & CALL CENTER LEAD

Full-Time | 100% Remote



POSITION OVERVIEW



- Company: GoHibachi

- Position: Sales Manager & Call Center Lead

- Employment Type: Full-Time, Permanent

- Location: 100% Remote

- Schedule: U.S. Business Hours

- Experience Required: Minimum 5 years | 10+ years preferred

- Compensation: Competitive base salary (discussed in interview) + performance commission





ABOUT GOHIBACHI



GoHibachi is a fast-growing private dining and events company that brings the authentic hibachi experience directly to customers — at homes, backyards, and private venues across the United States. We are expanding our sales operations and looking for a driven, senior-level sales professional to lead our outbound call center team and grow our revenue.





ABOUT THE ROLE



This is a high-impact leadership position. You will own our sales function — personally selling while managing a small team of sales agents. You set the standard: coaching your team, refining scripts and processes, tracking KPIs, and ensuring every prospect interaction reflects the GoHibachi brand. You report directly to company ownership and have real influence over how our sales operation grows.





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



[ SALES LEADERSHIP ]

- Manage, coach, and performance-review a small remote call center team

- Set daily, weekly, and monthly sales targets and hold the team accountable

- Develop, test, and continuously optimize call scripts and sales processes

- Run daily team huddles and weekly performance reviews

- Hire, onboard, and train new sales agents as the team scales



[ DIRECT SALES ]

- Personally work a pipeline of inbound leads, warm prospects, and referrals

- Handle escalated calls, high-value prospects, and complex bookings

- Close private event and group bookings for hibachi dining experiences



[ OPERATIONS & REPORTING ]

- Own and maintain the CRM — accurate pipeline data at all times

- Deliver weekly sales reports and forecasts directly to ownership

- Identify trends, gaps, and opportunities in the sales funnel

- Collaborate with marketing on lead generation and follow-up campaigns





QUALIFICATIONS



[ REQUIRED ]

- Minimum 5 years of proven sales experience & managing a sales team or call center— results you can demonstrate with numbers

- Strong spoken and written English

- Proficiency with CRM platform (GoHighLevel)

- Reliable high-speed internet and a professional, quiet home office setup

- Documented track record of hitting or exceeding individual and team sales quotas



[ PREFERRED ]

- 10+ years of sales experience

- Experience selling to U.S. customers over the phone (B2C)

- Background in outbound/inbound call center management

- Experience building sales processes and scripts from the ground up





WHAT WE OFFER



- Starting base salary of $800 USD/month

- Performance-based commission on personal sales and team revenue — uncapped

- Salary growth opportunities based on performance

- 100% remote, work-from-home position

- Direct access to ownership — your ideas will be heard and acted on

- Real growth opportunity: as GoHibachi expands, this role expands with it

- Stable, long-term employment with a growing U.S.-based company





HOW TO APPLY



To be considered, please submit ALL of the following:



1. Updated resume or CV (PDF or Word)

2. A brief cover letter (2–3 paragraphs) explaining your sales management experience

3. Your single most significant sales achievement — include real numbers (quota attained, team size managed, revenue generated)

4. Your expected monthly base salary (USD)



*Applications without a cover letter and documented sales achievement will not be reviewed.



GoHibachi | Private Dining & Hibachi Events | United States

title: Gaming YouTube Script Writer (HSR, ZZZ, JRPGs)
description:
A dream job for a gamer who loves to write!



I run a growing YouTube channel focused on gacha games and JRPGs. I’m looking for a script writer who genuinely loves gaming and can turn messy, complex game info (kits, lore, story beats, community drama, patch changes) into scripts that are easy to follow, entertaining and accurate.



YOU WILL BE WRITING ACROSS:

- Zenless Zone Zero (required deep knowledge)

- Honkai: Star Rail (required deep knowledge)

- JRPGs and other upcoming games (example: a plot summary for a Dragon Quest remaster)

- Future games (example: Ananta)



One week you might write a ZZZ character lore breakdown and a “push or skip” video for Honkai Star Rail. The next week you might write a story summary or “what you need to know” video for a completely different game.



WHAT YOU'LL DO:

Write YouTube scripts for:



- Character guides, lore explainers, “pull or skip”, patch overviews and other stuff that audiences might like

- Plot summaries and recaps (spoiler-safe when required)

- Short-form scripts (Shorts/Reels style)

- Take complicated mechanics or lore and make them simple for everyday viewers

- Match different tones depending on the audience and video goal (funny, serious, hype, explanatory, story-time)

- Suggest video opportunities based on what’s trending in the games we cover (patch cycles, banners, drama, community interest, search demand)



REQUIRED:

- No agency submissions - I’m looking for individuals who want to be part of a team yet enjoy working from home

- No AI-written scripts: when it comes to game guides, AI is often inaccurate and misses nuance. I’m hiring a human writer for a reason.

- Strong existing knowledge of Zenless Zone Zero and Honkai: Star Rail, including characters and lore (you will be asked specific questions to confirm this)

- Adaptable to learning new games fast

- Able to write clearly and logically, with strong pacing and hooks

- Fast delivery without sacrificing quality

- A PC, mobile device or console capable of playing the games we cover (ZZZ, HSR, and upcoming titles). Must be able to easily download and play new games that may need coverage.



NICE TO HAVE:

- A sense of humour 

- You already watch gaming YouTube and understand retention, hooks, pacing and “why people keep watching”

- You write and read A LOT

- You can pitch strong titles hooks, and thumbnail text options



PAY STRUCTURE (PATHWAY):

This role starts as per-script, with clear upside for great work.



Step 1: 8-week paid trial (pay-per-script)



- Pay per script based on length/format

- Clear deadlines agreed before each script

- Must be open to revisions and feedback (especially the first few weeks to get the tone of voice right with the YouTube channel)



Step 2: If we work well together



- We move to a small monthly retainer for a set number of scripts (still part-time), with extra scripts priced at the same per-script rate.



To apply: include your preferred rates for:



1. Your per-script rate (in PHP) for each format:



3–5 min script: $___

6–10 min script: $___

10–30 min script: $___



2. Your preferred monthly retainer after the trial (and what it includes):



“$___/month for ___ scripts” (tell me the mix and revision limits)





HOW TO APPLY



Send:

 1. A short intro about you and your gaming background

 2. Your writing samples (scripts preferred, otherwise any strong writing)

 3. Your rates per script length (listed above)

 4. Your weekly availability and typical turnaround time per script

 5. Confirm what device you use to play ZZZ/HSR (PC/mobile/console)

 6. Answer the short TEST TASKS below (copy/paste responses in your application)





TEST TASKS:

1. What’s your Honkai Star Rail or Zenless Zone Zero UID and region?

2.Describe the entire plot of Honkai Star Rail’s Amphoreus in 3 sentences or less. And make it personal and funny.

3. What's your favourite side quest in HSR or ZZZ, and why?

4. What’s the first JRPG you ever played, and what did you enjoy most about it?

5. Writing task: In
words only, explain how Honkai Star Rail’s Cyrene works to a brand new player.



NO AI-WRITTEN RESPONSES PLEASE! Any AI detection will result in the immediate rejection of your application.

title: Influencer Marketing Manager | Direct Client |Morning Shift
description:
Who Are We?

Nordic Quality is an extremely awesome, up-and-coming, online-based company selling physical products under several of our brands. The main one of which is in the gym and fitness category.



Who are we looking for?

We are looking for an Influencer Marketing Manager with some familiarity in Social Media Management to play a crucial role at Nordic Quality, a company specializing in gym equipment and weight-lifting products. This role involves managing and expanding partnerships with fitness influencers, as well as overseeing the brand’s social media presence across platforms like Instagram, TikTok, and
. The ideal candidate is passionate about health and fitness, stays up to date with social media trends, and has experience building engaging content and communities in the gym and weightlifting space.



WHAT WOULD THE TASK BE?



-Build all processes for acquiring new digital influencers, as well as maintaining existing ones.

-Identifying the most relevant influencers in the industry on major and minor social media channels such as YouTube,
, Instagram, Slickdeals, etc., by doing research and/ or using tools.

Form relationships with influencers before asking them to advocate for the products or the company in general.

- Persuade digital influencers to promote our products with little to no upfront cost;

- Ensure that all possible measures have been taken to retain existing influencers.

- Establish a Sponsored Athlete Program, affiliate programs, and partnerships with influencers, and manage everything related to these.

- Set up and take charge of activities surrounding the Influencer page on the company website;

- Boost the brand's online presence on relevant forums/message boards by responding to comments and subtly promoting our products.

- Lead the department dedicated to influencer marketing, once set up, and collaborate with other tea
mbers of other departments whenever necessary.

- Come up with a marketing plan/strategy on a weekly/monthly basis  (work alongside the marketing manager to do this, especially for our product promotions); 

- Tally UGCs for content posting on social media, including Instagram,
, YouTube, and TikTok.

- Social Media Management: Plan, coordinate, and schedule social media content on
, Instagram, and TikTok at least two weeks (14 days) in advance while also managing real-time updates and promotional posts in collaboration with the Marketing team/Marketing Assistant to keep calendars accurate, timely, and aligned with campaign priorities.

- Manage some Amazon Ads or work on other Amazon-related tasks in Amazon US, Amazon UK, and Amazon Japan (using ChatGPT whenever needed);

- Create an attribute link for promotions and influencers and analyze them as part of the KPI every month.

- Create and manage campaigns and influencers on Amazon Creator Connections on a regular basis.

- Create and maintain updated SOPs for the Influencer Team.

- Regularly review existing SOPs and make adjustments as needed.

- Other related tasks or tasks in the marketing department.

- Slack (communication tool) visibility during the contractor’s working hours. 



Qualifications:

- Proven experience in lead generation, influencer outreach, and social media management. Preferably in the e-commerce or fitness industry (but not necessarily)

- Familiarity with lead generation tools and CRM systems (is a plus!)

- Strong written and verbal communication skills.

-Has experience with Canva

- Has an interest in creating compelling social media posts

- Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines.

- Knowledge of basic marketing principles and techniques.

- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.



You must also have the following;

- With a perfectly working device (additional backup is a plus)

- With a reliable internet connection (additional backup is required)

- Headphones/earphones (for meetings)



HOW TO APPLY?

Congratulations on making it this far in the job application process! Interested? We'd be delighted to hear from you.

Please carefully follow all of the instructions below to send an application:



1. Use the following as the subject of your message:

Influencer Marketing - (Insert Your Full Name Here)

Example: Influencer Marketing - Maria Santos



2. Cover Letter - The body of your message will serve as your cover letter, so discuss your experience and persuade me to add you to the team while highlighting your writing abilities.



3 The link to your CV/ resume (strictly with your picture)



4. IMPORTANT NOTE: Type at least one of Nordic Quality's MAIN BRAND on the very first line of your cover letter. Here's a hint: Google is your best friend.

title: Senior Amazon Operations Manager (UK & USA) – Warehouse & Multi-Model Expert
description:
Job Title: Senior Amazon Operations Manager (UK & USA) – Warehouse & Multi-Model Expert



Role Overview:

We are seeking an elite Amazon Operations Manager to build and scale a multi-marketplace empire. This is a partner-track role for an expert who can handle the business from "scratch to scale." You will be responsible for the entire ecosystem—from sourcing in China/UK/USA to managing complex logistics and high-level account strategy.

Key Responsibilities:



1. Strategic Business Building: Build and manage stores from the ground up in both UK and USA marketplaces.

Logistics & Warehouse Management: Identify, vet, and manage compatible 3rd Party Logistics (3PL) and Prep Centres. You must choose the most cost-effective warehouse solutions based on the business model.



2. Advanced Listing Mastery: Full expertise in creating and optimizing complex Parent-Child Variations (size, color, pack size) to maximize conversion and SEO.



3. Multi-Model Expertise: Mastery of Wholesale, Online/Retail Arbitrage, and China Sourcing (Private Label).

Sourcing & Vendor Development: Expert in global vendor negotiations and building a robust supply chain.



4. Data & Financials: Conduct deep data analysis via Keepa and manage full accounting, expenses, and P&L reports.

Account Protection: High proficiency in resolving IP complaints, brand registry issues, and maintaining 100?count health.

Market Expansion: (Plus Point) Proficient in scaling sales to eBay and Walmart.

Candidate Requirements:



Experience: Minimum 5 years of high-level experience (or exceptional proven results with a portfolio).

The Tech Stack: Must be an expert with Helium 10, Keepa, SellerAmp, Tactical Arbitrage, Jungle Scout, IP Alert, and InventoryLab.



Leadership: Ability to manage the business autonomously. We are ready to hire more VAs under your leadership as we scale.

Communication: Fluent English is mandatory for vendor management and Amazon Seller Support interaction.



What We Offer:

Competitive Salary: Above-market base pay for top-tier talent.

Profit Sharing: A defined percentage of net profit upon hitting set growth targets.

Partnership Mindset: We treat you as a business partner, not just an employee.

Resources: Unlimited support for software, tools, and additional staff as required.

Longevity: This is a long-term cooperation opportunity.



How to Apply:

Submit your CV and a portfolio of Amazon accounts you have managed.

Briefly explain your process for selecting a compatible 3PL/Warehouse in the UK vs. the USA.

Describe your experience with complex Listing Variations.

Keyword: Start your application with "ELITE PARTNER



Mail or WhatsApp us on-

title: Video Editor (Contractor) – Full-Time Engagement
description:
Video Editor (Contractor) – Full-Time Engagement



Compensation: USD 1,500-2,500/ month (depending on experience + speed + quality)

Hours: Full-time contractor engagement (flexible, but overlap with 1pm–10pm Philippines time is required)

Output: 8 long-form videos/month (typically 2 per week). Some months may be 10–12 depending on schedule; additional videos are paid as add-ons.

Location: Remote

Type: Independent Contractor

Paid Trial: We typically start with a short paid trial project to make sure we’re aligned





About Get Me Links

We’re GetMeLinks — a multi-7-figure SEO + link-building operation with a 30+ person team serving clients across the US, UK, CA, and AU. Content is a core growth engine for us, and we’re building a channel that wins through clarity, authority, and real insight—not gimmicks. We move fast, we care about craft, and we’re allergic to fluff.





What You’ll Be Doing

- Edit long-form YouTube videos (talking-head, screen-recording, podcast-style) with a focus on retention and flow

- Turn rough edits into tight, high-signal storytelling: remove dead air, fix pacing, sharpen transitions, improve clarity

- B-roll + on-screen visuals that actually support what’s being said (not random stock footage)

- Create / source / generate simple but effective graphics (charts, overlays, callouts, chapter cards, UI mockups) using AI tools + templates

- Improve audio quality (cleanup, leveling, consistency) so it feels professional without feeling overproduced

- Maintain a clean visual language: zooms, punch-ins, pattern breaks, motion, captions (where needed), tasteful SFX

- Build repeatable systems:

      reusable templates (lower thirds, title cards, callout styles)

      editing checklists

      “retention patterns” playbook based on our analytics + what works on the channel

- Collaborate async with clear handoffs:

      receive notes and implement fast

      proactively flag issues (“this part drags”, “visual doesn’t match line”, “we should add a pattern break here”)

- Use AI like a power tool, not a crutch: speed up visual creation, ideation, and workflow—without lowering quality

- Deliver 8 long-form YouTube videos per month (typically 2/week). Some weeks may include a third video (one-off), usually from a repeatable series format.



Who You Are

- You’re not just an editor. You’re a retention-minded builder.

- You have strong taste and you know what “boring” looks like in the first 30 seconds

- You think in terms of viewer psychology: curiosity, 
ntum, payoff, pattern breaks, cognitive load

- You can take a messy timeline and make it feel inevitable

- You’re fast because you’re systematic, not because you rush

- You’re the kind of person who says:

       “We can cut 20% of this and make it hit harder”

       “That visual doesn’t match what he’s saying”

       "We need a state change here or retention will dip”

- You’re comfortable working with a founder-led brand (direct feedback, high standards, iterative improvement)

- You communicate cleanly: brief updates, clear questions, no drama



Requirements

- Proven experience editing YouTube long-form content with strong pacing (please include portfolio links)

- Strong command of Premiere Pro / DaVinci Resolve (Final Cut ok if you’re excellent)

- Solid audio handling: EQ, noise reduction, leveling, basic mastering

- Ability to implement feedback quickly and accurately

- Comfortable working during PH time overlap (1pm–10pm PH)

- Can deliver consistently (this is a full-time workload, not “a few hours a week”)

- Organized file management and version control habits (clean project files, naming conventions, exports)

- Familiarity with AI tools for:

     graphics generation

     faster asset creation

     transcript-based editing / cut detection / ideation support

- Reliable internet + a machine that can handle heavy editing



Bonus Points If You...

- Have edited content in B2B,  SEO / marketing / business / technical niches (where clarity matters more than flashy edits)

- Know how to read retention graphs and make surgical improvements

- Can build motion templates (After Effects) or clean UI-style animations

- Have a good eye for brand consistency (fonts, spacing, hierarchy, visual cleanliness)

- Can help improve our editing SOPs and make the process faster every month



Have experience with:

- Descript / Premiere text-based editing

- Runway / Pika / Midjourney / Photoshop AI (or equivalents)

- Caption workflows that don’t look cheesy



What You’ll Get

- USD
/ month based on skills and experience

- Remote-first, async-friendly culture — results over hours

- Real autonomy and real impact — this is your department to build

- A sharp team, strong values (Competence, Adaptability, Trust, Collaboration, Humanity), and no fluff



How to Apply (Follow These Steps Precisely)

Please
 the following to 
 with the subject:

“Video Editor – I’m [Your Name] and I edit high-retention content.”

Include:

    Your resume with two professional references

    Your DISC profile (free test at 
)

    Your portfolio (2–5 examples most relevant to retention + long-form)

    A short note: what makes your edits retain attention?

    Which tools you use (editing + AI)

    Your monthly rate expectation (USD range) and availability

    (Optional but strong) A 30–60s “before/after” showing how you improved pacing on a clip
