title: Recruiting Coordinator / Talent Sourcer (Philippines) – OnlineJobs.ph Hiring Pipeline + Screening + Reference Checks
description:
JOB TITLE

Recruiting Coordinator / Talent Sourcer (Philippines) – OnlineJobs.ph Hiring Pipeline + Screening + Reference Checks



ABOUT US

We are a retail store equipment supplier serving retailers with fixture and equipment solutions. We run a high-standard, premium operation: clear communication, clean processes, fast follow-through, and reliable execution.



We already use OnlineJobs.ph and have ongoing hiring needs. We want one long-term recruiter to become our internal hiring engine for Philippines-based talent.



FIRST PRIORITY ROLE

The first role you will recruit for is an ESTIMATOR with millwork / casework / commercial interiors estimating experience.



ROLES YOU WILL HELP US HIRE (OVER TIME)



* Executives / Oeprators

* Customer Service / Support

* Virtual Assistants (product uploads, catalog QA, admin)

* Ecommerce operations support roles

* SEO support

* Other roles as needed



YOUR MISSION

Protect leadership time by filtering aggressively and only presenting qualified candidates.



RESPONSIBILITIES



* Turn each role request into a clear scorecard (must-haves, nice-to-haves, dealbreakers)

* Write and post job ads on OnlineJobs.ph (and other channels when useful)

* Handle high-volume inbound applications without missing top talent

* Run first-pass screening and enforce structured applications (answers, proof, and short Loom when required)

* Conduct screening calls and produce short written evaluations

* Build shortlists with pros/cons, risks, compensation expectations, and availability

* Coordinate interview scheduling and keep candidates warm

* Run structured reference checks for finalists and deliver a written verification summary

* Maintain a simple pipeline tracker (Google Sheet) with stages, notes, and next actions

* Support onboarding setup (first-week checklist, expectations, reporting cadence)



WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE



* You deliver 3–5 truly qualified candidates per role, not 50 mediocre ones

* Hiring cycles move fast (no bottlenecks, no chasing us for updates)

* Candidates are pre-validated (real experience, clear communication, reliable)

* Our time is spent interviewing only the best



MUST-HAVE EXPERIENCE



* Proven recruiting or sourcing for Philippines-based remote hires

* Strong OnlineJobs.ph experience (posting, sourcing, filtering, messaging)

* Able to screen for real skills vs inflated resumes

* Excellent written English and professional candidate communication

* Comfortable running reference checks and documenting findings

* Organized and process-driven (checklists, trackers, follow-ups)



STRONG PLUS



* Familiarity with paid trial workflows and skills tests



WORK SETUP



* Remote

* Ongoing role

* Expected commitment: freelance availability when needed, not full / part time at the 
nt



PAY



* Hourly



APPLICATION GATE (MUST FOLLOW)

If you do not follow these requirements, we will not respond.



1. Start your message with this exact word: HR BLUEPRINT

2. Include your hourly rate 

3. Record a short Loom video covering:



   * Your OnlineJobs.ph recruiting experience (what roles you’ve filled and how)

   * How you screen high volumes without missing top candidates

   * How do you make sure their resume's and history is not faked

   * How you run reference checks (your approach)



That’s it. Keep it simple and specific.



NOT A FIT FOR



* Resume forwarding without screening

* Recruiters who only post jobs and wait

* Anyone who can’t write clearly and follow a structured process

* Anyone unwilling to provide proof of process and outputs

title: Virtual Assistant – Email Outreach, LinkedIn Growth & Schedule Management
description:
We are a U.S.-based company looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support two brands under one management team. This is a long-term position with clearly documented systems already in place. You will not be building anything from scratch — you will be executing proven processes daily.

Brand 1: Professional Services Firm (Bookkeeping, Accounting & Cash Flow Management)

This brand serves medium-sized business owners generating $500K–$5M in annual revenue. Your responsibilities include:



Managing my personal calendar, coordinating meetings, sending reminders, and handling scheduling conflicts before I have to ask.

Growing my LinkedIn account by posting provided content, engaging with prospects, and running connection campaigns targeting business owners, CEOs, founders, and operations managers in that revenue range. You will use LinkedIn automation tools (we currently use Meet Alfred but are open to your recommendation if you can back it up with results).

The goal is simple: build a network of business owners who need accounting, bookkeeping, and cash flow management services. You post, you engage, you grow the audience. Content will be provided.



Brand 2: Music Artist Management

This brand manages a Nashville-based country music artist who performs with a full band and is actively booking paid shows across five U.S. states. Your responsibilities include:



Executing a pre-built venue outreach system. There are 624 venue contacts loaded into a spreadsheet with a full
 Playbook and SOP already written. Every
 is pre-written. You customize the placeholders, send on schedule, and log every touchpoint. You do not write or rewrite anything.

Growing the artist's LinkedIn account by posting provided content and running connection campaigns targeting venue booking managers, talent buyers, promoters, event coordinators, festival organizers, and music industry professionals. Same approach — post, engage, grow.



What This Role Requires Every Day:



Follow documented SOPs and Playbooks exactly as written. No improvising.

Send 30–50 outreach
s per day on a structured schedule and log every send same-day.

Post and engage on two LinkedIn accounts using automation tools.

Manage my calendar and flag conflicts or gaps proactively.

Communicate clearly. If something is unclear, ask before you act.



What You Do NOT Need To Do:



Write
s or marketing copy. Everything is pre-written.

Create content. It will all be provided to you.

Make strategic decisions. We handle strategy. You handle execution.



What Will Make You Stand Out:



You have real experience with LinkedIn automation tools — Meet Alfred, Linked Helper, Expandi, or similar.

You have managed
 outreach sequences before and understand follow-up timing and tracking.

You are organized enough to manage two brands without mixing things up.

You work during U.S. Central Time business hours with at least 4–6 hours of overlap.

You treat this like a career, not a task list.



If you read this entire post, include the word "828" somewhere in your application so we know.

title: Full-time Entry Virtual Associate (VA) Positions. Philippines time zone. 260226
description:
This is an entry-level role, where the majority of knowledge and skills will be acquired through on-the-job training, paving the way for advancement to senior positions.



Are you seeking a full-time, long-term career that offers exceptional growth potential through advancement opportunities, along with a stable income and bonus incentives? Join our team if you have a keen eye for detail, an unwavering drive for productivity, and a strong sense of responsibility. If you possess self-motivation, assertiveness, and a strong work ethic, coupled with a positive outlook and the ability to excel in a fast-paced work environment, we invite you to reach out to us.



You will receive training and support for your work. Candidates without experience but willing to learn and grow are welcome.

This is for candidates who are keen to develop a professional career that allows you to work remotely and independently. There are career paths with promising future opportunities that have traditionally been accessible only through conventional means. However, our embrace of technology, good jobs are no longer restricted to traditional ways.



About Us

The business has collaborated with a highly acclaimed loan brokerage and independent financial advisory firm, along with several other partners, all of which are fully licensed by government authorities. We offer a diversified suite of financial services and solutions with a personalized approach.



With these partners, we have one of the largest, most-respected, and fastest-growing networks of advisers in the country. We provide sound and comprehensive financial advice at both individual and corporate levels.



Requirement

• Strong verbal and written English skills with a neutral accent.

• Knowledge of Chinese/Mandarin, whether verbal or written, is a significant advantage.

• Exceptional talent for natural conversation.

• Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.

• Owns a competent Windows computer/laptop and android mobile phone for work

• A dependable and consistent internet connection

• Consistent and reliable power supply without frequent outages.

• A distraction-free and quiet workspace.

• Utilizing a headset equipped with Noise Cancellation technology.

• Takes initiative and works independently to address challenges, consistently seeking solutions.



Other Matters

We will be communicating via various communication tools. There will be a probation period for one to three months, depending on your qualifications and experience, which is negotiable. Upon the completion of your probation period, you will become eligible for a 13th-month bonus, paid time off, and a range of employee benefits, including PhilHealth and the Social Security System. The annual performance bonus is determined by your key performance indicators (KPIs). You will follow the time zone of the Philippines. Among colleagues, your working hours may be arranged in rotation, including weekdays and weekends. A total work week of 40 hours. Your further potential salary growth will be based on your performance, which may be increased during the quarterly review.



Loan Support

You will learn on the job to handle the primary job scope that includes:

• Engage with incoming leads primarily through WhatsApp on our business phone.

• Create comprehensive reports that incorporate inputs and details provided by clients.

• Create concise summaries and propose options for clients, utilizing templates for efficiency.

• Collaborate with the designated bankers to facilitate the processing of loan applications

• Schedule meetings with clients and bankers.

• Reach out to current clients as they approach the end of their loan lock-in period.

• Oversee client relationships and enhance processes through multiple CRM platforms.



Insurance and Investment Support

You will learn on the job to handle the primary job scope that includes:

• Prepare the required documentation for the client's application, available in various systems.

• Reach out to clients through WhatsApp using our business phone, primarily to provide reminders and follow-ups.

• Utilize WhatsApp (business phone) as the main channel to engage clients and schedule appointments effectively.

• Craft client proposals utilizing the provided templates.

• Helping clients with insurance claims

• Contact insurers to obtain quotes and provide recommendations to clients.

• Oversee client relationships and streamline processes through a range of CRM systems.



Candidates who have shown capability and knowledge may be groomed towards senior roles or management roles.



Application

To apply for the job:

Please log in and click the link below to apply, and please follow the instructions.



There will be an assessment and a Microsoft Teams interview video call required, if you are shortlisted.

title: AI Image Creator / Image Editor (Detail-Oriented)
description:
We’re looking for someone who can create AI-generated images and actually make them look real.



This role is for someone who notices when an AI image feels off — strange hands, odd lighting, unnatural faces, weird backgrounds — and knows how to fix or improve those details.



This is a test role for internal workflows, so tasks will start simple and may grow over time.



What you’ll do:



- Generate images using AI tools based on simple prompts

- Review outputs and spot unrealistic or unusual details

- Edit or refine images to make them more natural and polished

- Apply feedback and make revisions when needed



What we’re looking for:



- Strong eye for detail and realism

- Experience using AI image generators (any tools are fine)

- Basic image editing skills (Photoshop, Canva, or similar)

- Can follow instructions and revise work properly



How to Apply



Please apply with:

- A short intro about your experience with AI image generation

- Samples or examples of AI images you’ve created or edited

- The tools you use for image generation and editing



Shortlisted candidates may be asked to complete a small test task.

title: Bookkeeper / Operations VA
description:
About Us: 



We are a leading-edge law firm located in Australia with international offices in New Zealand and the Middle East. Pioneering digital and online technology, we have transformed into a fully electronically-enabled law firm. We are currently seeking expressions of interest for a remote Bookkeeper/Operation VA, allowing you to work from the comfort of your home. 



 

Reporting to: Accountant of the firm, and will assist the Director and Legal Operations Manager 





Responsibilities: 



• Assist in managing financial record, and reconciliation of accounts 



• Assist in invoicing and billing, entering timesheet on our practice management system 



• Process and track invoices, ensuring timely payments from clients and vendors. Monitor outstanding invoices and follow up on collections. 



• Assist the team with e-filing, file and document management, and appointment setting 



• Assist the accountant with bookkeeping tasks 



• Assist in maintaining books and accounting system up to date 



• Act as support staff to operation when needed and will work closely with the Director and Operations Manager 



• Perform other ad hoc tasks as required 



 



Requirements: 



• University/College degree in Accounting or Finance is a mandatory requirement  



• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English 



• Attention to detail is a must 



• Fully experienced in using Microsoft Office products and applications 



• Experience with Microsoft Teams is highly desirable 



• 2 Years Bookkeeping Experience 



• Familiarity with practice and project management systems like LEAP or Zoho Project is an advantage 



• Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously 



• High-speed internet connection and a designated workspace 



• A noise-cancelling headset is required 



• Experience in Zoho One Suite, desirable but not required, training will be provided 



• You will be required to provide your own computer that must meet the following requirements: Windows 10 and Office 
puter requirement is 8GB RAM or higher and processor should be CORE i3 and above as our minimum requirement or equivalent, and 1 TB HDD or SSD drive 



• You will be required to have your own high-speed internet connection and a backup system or data plan that will be required for any internet outages, preferably with 5G connection or equivalent. 



• You will be required to have your own designated workspace that will allow you to focus on your workday and commitments that will require you to engage with clients from around the country, therefore requiring a quiet workspace as well as a noise-cancelling headset. 



• Ability to work in the Australian time zone 



 



Benefits: 



• Full-time employment with a minimum of 48 working hours per week  



• The position offers a possibility for advancement within the firm. 



 



Place of Work: 



• Remote work – Employee to supply their own PC/Phone/Internet and to install any required software on their phone or GPS location to enable sign-in and sign-out of work and to track all tasks, activities, and projects worked on. 



 



Application Process: 



• To apply, please send your resumes and cover letters.

title: Local SEO & Inbound Lead Manager – Revenue Focused (US Hours Required)

title: Amazon Graphic/Digital Designer |WHF| Immediate Hire
description:
About Black Compass 



We are a rapidly growing business looking for talented individuals to join our team. Our business manages $25 million in annual advertising revenue. We are committed to developing top talent and bringing them along for the journey. We hire based on culture fit, and experience is a major plus! 



Overview 



We’re looking for a designer with strong branding and eCommerce instincts to create high-converting e-commerce creatives including listing images, A+ content, and Brand Store pages. This role focuses on visual storytelling, clarity, and conversion.  



You’ll work closely with the Creative Director to create marketing and copy to translate product benefits into compelling, Amazon-optimized visuals. There will be opportunities to extend your design skills into other areas of marketing such as pitch design, branding, and social. There will be future opportunities to help refine and redefine creative processes.  



Core Responsibilities 

> Design e-commerce listing images, A+ content, and Brand Store pages (Amazon) 

> Create clear, conversion-focused layouts that communicate benefits quickly 

> Develop iconography, infographics, and comparison visuals 

> Ensure all designs meet technical and brand guidelines 

> Collaborate with Art director and marketers to bring product narratives to life 

> Iterate designs based on performance insights and feedback 

> Apply brand guidelines to brand’s extended creative presence 

> Organize and deliver final assets for upload and testing 

> Contribute design support to new business pitches, presentations, and cross-agency creative tasks.  

> Help structure workflows, improve design processes, and raise the overall craft level of the team. 



Required Skills & Experience 

> 3+ years of graphic design experience (eCommerce or performance marketing a plus) 

> Strong understanding of conversion-focused design principles 

> Proficiency in Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, Microsoft Suite, Teamwork or similar tools 

> Able to leverage AI tools for creating  

> Ability to design within tight constraints and fixed formats 

> Strong attention to detail and consistency 

> Taking initiative  

> Growth mentality 

> Ability to work independently and manage multiple assets/projects 



Nice to Have 

> Proven experience designing for Amazon creative content or product listings  

> Experience working with Amazon Brand Stores 

> Familiarity with CRO, UX, or performance marketing 

> Understanding of how design impacts Amazon SEO and shopper behavior 

> Experience collaborating with paid media or growth teams 



Benefits: 

> 5 Days’ Vacation Paid Time Off 

> Time Off For 9 National PH Holidays 

> Company Events – Free Dinner, Games Night 

> Year End Bonus – We Pay 1% of Company Profits To Our Employees 

> Flex hours

title: E-Commerce Manager (Operations Coordinator) – Monthly Bonus - Fast Growing North American Agency
description:

We currently employ 100+ tea
mbers across North America, Europe, and Asia, and we are expanding aggressively.

title: Ecommerce Specialist (Shopify)
description:
Job Title: Ecommerce Specialist (Shopify)

Department: Ecommerce

Employment Type: Full-time

Start: Immediate

Mon-Friday 9am-5pm AEST

Weekly Payment US$306



About the Role

We’re looking for a detail-driven Ecommerce Specialist to support the Ecommerce Manager across two DTC fashion

brands. This role plays a critical part in the day-to-day running and performance of both

Shopify stores, supporting trading, merchandising, digital marketing, and inventory-led decision making.



You’ll work closely with ecommerce, marketing, creative, and operations teams to ensure both online stores are commercially optimised, well-merchandised, and supported by accurate reporting and insights.



Key Responsibilities



Ecommerce Operations (Shopify)

- Assist in the daily management of the stores

- Maintain product listings, collections, pricing, tags, and merchandising rules

- Build and manage homepage updates, landing pages, navigation, and promotional content

- Support product launches, seasonal drops, sale events, and site-wide promotions

- Monitor site performance and troubleshoot issues in collaboration with developers and app partners



Online Merchandising & Trading

- Support online merchandising strategies to maximise conversion, AOV, and sell-through

- Manage product ordering and collection structure to align with seasonal trading goals

- Implement upsell, cross-sell, bundle, and promotional strategies

- Ensure best practice execution across PDPs (imagery, copy, sizing, reviews, FAQs)

- Support A/B testing and CRO initiatives to improve onsite performance



Sales Analysis, Reporting & Forecasting

- Analyse daily, weekly, and monthly sales performance across both brands

- Produce ecommerce trading reports covering revenue, conversion, AOV, traffic, and product performance

- Identify trends, risks, and opportunities through sales and customer data

- Assist with forecasting and scenario planning for promotions and seasonal peaks

- Support post-campaign analysis and trading recaps



Inventory Management & Buying Support

- Monitor stock levels, sell-through, and weeks of cover across both DTC businesses

- Support inventory management and stock optimisation to minimise sell-outs and overstock

- Assist in the preparation of reports to inform future purchase orders and buy quantities

- Work with operations and planning teams on stock flow, replenishment, and back-in-stock priorities

- Maintain accurate product and inventory data within Shopify and connected systems



Digital Marketing Support

- Assist in the execution and optimisation of paid digital campaigns (Meta, Google, TikTok)

- Align ecommerce promotions with paid media,
, and SMS activity

- Support creative testing, campaign setup, and performance analysis

- Monitor ROAS and conversion performance, feeding insights back into trading decisions



Cross-Functional Collaboration

- Work closely with Ecommerce, Marketing, Creative, Planning, and Operations teams

- Support customer service teams with product, stock, and promotion knowledge

- Ensure seamless execution of campaigns across site, paid media, and CRM



Essential

- 2–4+ years’ experience in ecommerce, ideally within fashion or apparel DTC

- Strong hands-on experience with Shopify

- Demonstrated experience in online merchandising, sales analysis, and reporting

- Understanding of inventory management, sell-through, and buying cycles

- Experience supporting paid digital campaigns (Meta, Google)

- High attention to detail with strong organisational and analytical skills



Desirable

- Experience working across multiple brands or storefronts

- Experience with Klaviyo, Gorgias, and Shopify apps

- Exposure to inventory systems such as CIN7 or similar

- Basic understanding of HTML/CSS or Shopify Liquid

- Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator capabilities

- Experience with digital ad campaign platforms



Personal Attributes

- Commercially minded with strong numerical confidence

- Proactive and solutions-focused

- Comfortable managing multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

- Strong communicator and collaborative team player

- Passion for fashion, ecommerce, and DTC brands



Why Join Us

- Work across two established and globally recognised DTC brands

- Be part of a high-performing ecommerce and digital team

- Gain exposure to trading, merchandising, and buying decision-making

- Opportunity to grow into a senior ecommerce or trading role

title: Outbound Partnerships Assistant (Creator Partnerships)

We are growing and looking for a highly detail-oriented, proactive Outbound Partnerships Assistant to help scale our brand outreach efforts.



What You’ll Do:

- Research brands aligned with our creators

- Find marketing contacts (LinkedIn +
 tools)

- Send personalized cold outreach
s

- You will not need to handle negotiations, contracts, or payments

We’re Looking For Someone Who:

- Is passionate about social media

- Is tapped in and interested in US brands

- Is a foodie! We represent a lot of home chefs!

- Is extremely detail-oriented (no name mistakes or sharing the wrong creator info)

- Has experience with cold
 outreach

 plus social platforms)



Weekly Expectations:

, text or slack

To Apply:

- Your weekly availability (M,T,Th; M-F; M,W,F; let us know what works)



Once we receive your application, we may request:

- A sample cold outreach
 (Pitch your favorite content creator for a partnership with any brand of your choosing)



Feel free to ask questions if there's anything we can clarify for you.



Thank you! Excited to read through your applications :)

title: Marketing Executive | Remote | UK Property Company
description:
Work From Home | Long Term Career Growth | AI, Content, SEO and Paid Ads



Bi-weekly Pay



Luxury Hub and Pure Green are fast growing UK based property companies managing over £20m in assets and securing £30m in investment funding for future developments.



We operate at the intersection of property, technology, performance marketing and social impact, delivering modern estate agency and lettings services across the UK.



We are expanding our Philippines based team and are hiring a Marketing Executive for a long term, full time role focused on execution, performance and continuous improvement.



This role is ideal for someone who is tech savvy, design aware, comfortable with AI and happy to be hands on across content, SEO,
, website updates and automation.



WHY JOIN US



• Work remotely for a stable UK based company

• Long term role with guaranteed hours and job security

• Real campaigns with real budgets

• Daily use of AI tools including ChatGPT, Canva AI and CapCut AI

• Exposure to UK marketing strategy, funnels and performance data

• Work closely with senior leadership including CMO and Operations

• Clear progression as the business scales

• Annual performance review with potential pay increase



We invest in our people. You will get support and systems to help you grow your skills and confidence, not just complete tasks.



OUR CULTURE AND VALUES



At Luxury Hub, culture matters. We are building a long term team, not short term contractors.



Our core values are:



• Shared Vision – Aligning personal ambition with company success and shared goals

• Virtue and Talents – Individual talents are recognised and nurtured

• Continuous Improvement – We welcome feedback, stay curious, innovate and improve

• Focused Contribution – We play to our strengths and passions to create real impact

• Meaningful Partnerships – We believe in mutual value creation and growing together



We are looking for people who want to build something meaningful, grow their skills and contribute beyond just completing tasks.



WHAT YOU WILL DO

Marketing and Campaign Execution



• Execute weekly and monthly marketing campaigns across digital channels

• Manage and maintain marketing action lists and content calendars

• Create marketing assets, posts and supporting materials

• Research trends, competitors and opportunities across social platforms



Paid Advertising



• Assist with Meta Ads and Google Display campaigns

• Create ad creatives, hooks, captions and visuals

• Monitor CPL, CTR and conversions

• Suggest and apply optimisations



SEO, GEO and Website Updates



• Support basic SEO and GEO tasks including on page optimisation, content updates and metadata

• Carry out basic website updates such as CMS edits, landing pages and content changes

• Work with the team to improve website performance and conversion



AI, Automation and Continuous Improvement



• Use AI tools daily to generate content ideas, captions, scripts, designs and workflows

• Identify opportunities to automate or improve marketing processes using AI

• Continuously look for ways to work smarter and faster



 Campaigns, CRM and Reporting



• Support
 campaigns, outbound
ing and basic automations

• Maintain and update CRM records

• Track leads, campaigns and sources

• Support basic marketing performance reporting



Brand and Quality Control



• Maintain strict brand consistency

• Continuously improve output quality across all channels



WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR



We are skills first, not CV first.



You should have:



• Design Experience in a design tool.  InDesign or Adobe Photoshop, Canva.

• Demonstrable experience in digital marketing, content creation, SEO or paid ads

• Strong Canva skills and a good design eye

• Ability to edit short form videos using CapCut, Premiere Pro or similar tools

• Confidence using AI tools daily

• Comfort working with website backends or CMS and learning new tools quickly

• Strong written English

• A proactive, improvement focused mindset

• Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

• Availability to work UK hours from 9 AM to 5 PM GMT

• No other full time job or full time study commitments



A portfolio or examples of previous work is required.



COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS



• PHP 318 to 330 per hour based on skills and portfolio

• Bi weekly pay

• Paid time off

• KPI based performance bonuses of up to PHP 35 per hour extra

• Annual performance and pay review



Guaranteed pay security

If we do not provide enough work, you will still be paid for at least 75 percent of your contracted hours.



As the company grows, we plan to introduce:



• Thirteenth month pay

• Fourteenth month performance bonus after three years

• Bonus days off every 80 hours worked after probation

• Health stipend of up to PHP 2,000 per month after two years

• Increased leave credits

• Expanded long term benefits

• Company loan options after two years



HOW TO APPLY



• Complete this short application form: 

• No CV required at this stage. Portfolio will be reviewed.



 Join us and grow your career with a UK-based real estate company. We will be accepting applications until 10th March 2026, 11:59 PM GMT.

title: Long-Form YouTube Editor (Documentary / Historical Storytelling Style)
description:
We are building a long-form YouTube channel focused on dramatic historical storytelling for a U.S. male audience.



We are looking for a reliable, long-term video editor who understands pacing, tension, and emotional storytelling.



This is NOT vlog-style editing.

This is NOT 
-style editing.

This is serious, documentary-style content.





???? Editing Style Requirements:



. Clean documentary pacing



. Strong hook (first 30 seconds must feel engaging)



. Visual change every 3–6 seconds



. Relevant stock footage and images



. Subtle zooms and motion



. Clean subtitles (minimal, professional style)



. No flashy effects or over-editing



. We prioritize storytelling clarity over cinematic complexity.





???? Video Details:



. Length: 8–15 minutes (may increase later)



. Frequency: 2–3 videos per week initially (growing channel)



. Voiceover and script provided



. Clear editing guidelines will be given





? Requirements:



Reliable internet



. Fast communication



. Can meet deadlines



. Understand audience retention basics



. Willing to improve and grow long-term



. Experience editing YouTube long-form content





???? Payment:



Please include:



1. Your rate for a 10-minute video



2. 2–3 examples of long-form videos you’ve edited



3. The word “Legacy” at the top of your message



Performance bonuses are available as the channel grows.



Applications without the word “Legacy” will not be reviewed.

title: HIPAA CERTIFIED EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT!
description:
The Executive Assistant will serve as a **professional and personal support partner**, managing daily administrative tasks, coordinating communications, and assisting in both clinical and personal matters. This role requires someone who is **emotionally intelligent, organized, and comfortable interacting with American clients and families** in a compassionate yet professional manner..



## Key Responsibilities

**Administrative & Executive Support**

- Manage the client’s calendar, appointments, and therapy sessions.

- Draft, organize, and maintain confidential client records in compliance with **HIPAA** standards.

- Handle
 management — sorting, prioritizing, and drafting responses when needed.

- Support with documentation, report preparation, and data entry related to therapy sessions.

- Coordinate communication between families, agencies, and other professionals.



**Client & Interview Coordination**

- Schedule and conduct intake or follow-up calls with clients and families as needed.

- Confidently interview American families, caregivers, or professionals to gather essential information.

- Ensure interactions reflect empathy, professionalism, and understanding of special needs contexts.



**Personal Assistance**

- Assist the client with personal and lifestyle management tasks (e.g., scheduling personal appointments, reminders, travel coordination).

- Help organize digital and personal files for improved efficiency.

- Provide overall day-to-day support to streamline the client’s professional and personal workflow.



## Requirements



- Background in **psychology, social work, or behavioral sciences** (preferred).

- Experience as an **Executive Assistant**, **Administrative Coordinator**, or **Client Relations Specialist**.

- Strong understanding of **HIPAA compliance** and confidentiality practices.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills; comfortable speaking with American clients.

- Highly organized, detail-oriented, and emotionally intelligent.

- Proficient with online scheduling, documentation, and communication tools.



Kindly send your updated CV along with a 1-2min self intro to proceed. Thank you!

title: Virtual Assistant - Permitting Contact Center Agent
description:
We're Hiring: Virtual Assistant – Permitting Company (Inbound/Outbound Calls Specialist)



Are you a highly motivated Virtual Assistant with a talent for communication and a background in the permitting industry? Do you excel at handling both inbound and outbound calls with professionalism and efficiency? If yes, we want you on our team!



About Us:

We are a fast-growing staffing company providing seamless solutions for businesses and individuals navigating the permitting process. Our mission is to take the stress out of permitting by offering clear, timely, and effective support every step of the way.



Role: Virtual Assistant – Permitting Support

Type: Full-Time (Remote)

Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8 AM - 4 PM PST



Responsibilities:



Handle high-volume inbound and outbound calls with clients, contractors, and government offices



Schedule appointments, follow up on permit status, and relay updates to clients



Assist in preparing and submitting permit applications



Maintain and update internal databases and CRM systems



Provide administrative support to the permitting team



Build and maintain strong professional relationships with clients and partners



Requirements:



Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant, Call Center Representative, or similar role



Experience in the permitting industry or construction-related fields preferred



Exceptional verbal and written communication skills



Strong phone presence and active listening skills



Proficiency in tools such as Google Workspace, CRM software (ZOHO, Monday, Airtable), and VoIP systems (Ring Central, Textline)



Reliable internet connection and a quiet work environment



Highly organized, detail-oriented, and self-driven



Bonus Points If You:

Are familiar with common permitting software platforms



Can handle multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously



How to Apply:

Send your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your relevant experience. Please include “Virtual Assistant – Permitting” in your subject line.

title: Client Success Manager (CSM)
description:
About the Role



Egen Media is a rapidly growing real estate lead generation company specializing in exclusive seller leads for real estate agents across the United States.



We are hiring a proactive, confident, and highly organized Client Success Manager to help our agents succeed with our lead programs while ensuring long-term retention and client satisfaction.



This is NOT a basic support role.



You will act as a strategic partner to our clients — guiding expectations, solving problems, increasing performance, and helping agents stay committed to the program long-term.



Your primary responsibility is protecting client success and retention.



Communication Skills (CRITICAL)



You must be confident communicating with U.S.-based real estate professionals through:



Phone Calls



Google Meetings




 Messaging



 Communication



Clients range from newer agents to high-performing brokers.



Communication must be:



Professional



Clear



Confident



Direct (without being confrontational).



Strong English fluency is required.



You must be comfortable handling difficult conversations and resetting expectations when necessary.



Primary Duty — Client Onboarding



You will lead onboarding calls for new clients joining Egen Media.



You will guide agents through:



How seller leads work.



Lead expectations and timelines.



Follow-up best practices.



CRM usage recommendations.



ISA support and lead handling.



How to maximize conversions.



The onboarding call sets the tone for long-term retention.



Problem Solver Mindset (NOT Just Support)



Agents may raise concerns such as:



Lead quality questions.



Conversion frustrations.



Follow-up challenges.



Market conditions.



Unrealistic expectations.



Your responsibility is to:



Reset expectations professionally.



Identify agent-side bottlenecks.



Educate clients on marketing realities.



Work alongside internal teams to resolve issues.



You are the bridge between clients and operations.



Organizational Excellence Required



You will manage a large client portfolio.



Strong organization is mandatory.



You must be comfortable:



Tracking client progress.



Managing follow-ups.



Logging conversations.



Monitoring pauses/unpauses.



Tracking complaints or churn risks.



Attention to detail is critical.



Success Metrics (What Winning Looks Like)

High Client Retention



Clients continue purchasing leads because they feel supported and understand the process.



Increased Lifetime Value (LTV)



Agents increase lead volume or stay active longer.



Reduced Escalations



Problems are solved before reaching management.



Upsell Opportunities



You identify when clients are ready for:



Increased lead volume.



Booked appointment services.



Coaching or add-on programs.



Key Responsibilities



Conduct onboarding calls for new clients.



Manage client communication through 
 and calls.



Address lead quality questions professionally.



Coordinate with internal ISA and VA teams.



Monitor client fulfillment and performance.



Track cancellations, pauses, and churn risks.



De-escalate concerns professionally.



Maintain detailed CRM notes and tracking.



Work closely with ownership and operations leadership.



Preferred Experience (Bonus)



(Not required but highly preferred)



Marketing agency experience.



Lead generation or real estate experience.



CRM experience (GoHighLevel preferred).



Customer success or account management roles.



Requirements



Fluent English (spoken and written).



Reliable high-speed internet.



Your own 64-bit computer.



Google Sheets familiarity.



Comfortable using CRM systems.



Required Schedule



Monday — Friday



10:00 AM — 6:00 PM Central Standard Time (CST)



Availability during U.S. business hours is required.



Growth Opportunity



Top performers will transition into full-time leadership opportunities as Egen Media continues to scale.



How to Apply



Send an
 to:







Subject Line:



CSM Application — Egen Media



Include:



Resume.



OnlineJobs.ph Profile Link.



Short introduction about your experience.



Qualified applicants will receive a follow-up application form.



Attention to Detail Test



In the application form, you will be asked your favorite number.



Answer:



17



(This confirms attention to detail.)

title: Marketing and ECommerce Assistant
description:
Multimedia Technology is a dynamic and trusted partner in tomorrow’s technology landscape, connecting people and powering the world’s economy. We simplify the technology supply chain through strong, meaningful relationships.



Working with leading global IT and AV brands such as Sony, Panasonic, Samsung, Synology, BenQ, Nvidia, Fujitsu, and HP, you will promote industry-leading products to some of Australia’s best-known businesses.



As a Marketing and ECommerce Assistant, you will play a key role in elevating our brand presence and driving demand across digital channels. With a strong marketing focus, you will support marketing campaigns, promotions, and product launches while optimising online content and marketplace performance.  You will collaborate with internal teams to ensure consistent brand messaging and strong commercial outcomes.



Key Responsibilities:



Create print and digital internal marketing materials, including content, creative assets, and sales collateral



Support and execute digital marketing initiatives including
 marketing, SEO optimisation, keyword research, and performance tracking through Google Analytics



Assist in campaign planning, vendor promotions, and engagement initiatives



Optimise product listings with accurate, compelling descriptions, specifications, imagery, and pricing



Assist with Multimedia Technology’s presence across online marketplaces



Drive automation between Multimedia and customers through EDI/Datafeed integration, ensuring live pricing accuracy.





To succeed in this role, you will have:



Hands-on experience managing eCommerce websites, portals, or online marketplaces



Experience supporting digital marketing activities 
, SEO, content, analytics)



Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret sales and performance data



A creative and strategic mindset with strong customer orientation



The ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment



Strong stakeholder management and relationship-building skills



Ability to understand, interpret, and adapt to new technology and IT products



Excellent written and verbal communication skills



Please note you must be available to work Mon - Fri 9am -5.30p
lbourne time.  Please attach a resume.

title: Figma Web Designer (Real Estate & Construction Brands)
description:

Location: Remote

JerryCo is a growing marketing and development agency focused on real estate, construction, and service-based brands. We build clean, modern, high-converting websites for serious businesses.

We are currently hiring a Figma Web Designer to lead design for a new wholesale real estate brand called Verified Home Buyer.

This project will be the starting point, with many additional projects available long-term.

Compensation

title: Technical Content Lead
description:
TECHNICAL CONTENT LEAD

(Title doesn’t matter. Impact does.)



There’s a specific kind of person we’re looking for.

Not just a writer.

Not just a developer.

Someone who has lived through WordPress.



You’ve built the late-night client sites.

You’ve wrestled with Elementor layouts that broke for no reason.

You’ve refreshed a dashboard and held your breath after updating plugins.

You’ve migrated hosts, cleaned hacked installs, debugged WooCommerce checkout chaos.



And somewhere along the way… you started writing about it.



Maybe it was a blog.

Maybe Medium.

Maybe just long Reddit replies where you explained things better than the official documentation ever did.



And you realized something:



You’re not just good at building things.

You’re good at explaining them.



You can take something technical, messy, and overwhelming…

and make it feel simple. Human. Clear.



If you’re reading this and thinking,

“Wait. That’s literally me.”

Keep reading.





WHY THIS ROLE EXISTS



SGEN is building something better.



But here’s the truth:



It doesn’t matter how good a product is if no one understands it.

We need someone who makes SGEN understandable to the outside world.



When someone Googles a question at 1:14 AM — frustrated, stuck, ready to quit —

 they shouldn’t find silence.



They should find you.



Clear answers.

Honest comparisons.

Step-by-step guidance.

A voice that sounds like a smart friend, not a corporate manual.



You are the bridge between complexity and clarity.



WHO YOU ARE



You’re naturally curious.

If something doesn’t have documentation, you don’t wait to be assigned. You fix it.



You open a product and instinctively think:

“This needs a getting-started guide.”

“That error message needs explaining.”

“New users will get stuck here.”



You remember what it felt like to not know what a CMS was.



And when you explain it, you don’t use jargon.

You don’t flex vocabulary.

You just make it make sense.



Your writing feels like a conversation over coffee.

Not stiff.

Not robotic.

Not AI-generated.

Just clear.



YOU HAVE OPINIONS (AND THAT'S GOOD)



You probably have thoughts about WordPress architecture.



You might love it.

You might be tired of it.

You definitely have stories.



We don’t need neutral.

We don’t need safe.



We need someone who can say:

“Here’s why this is broken.”

“Here’s why this is better.”

“And here’s where we still need to improve.”



Fair. Honest. Confident.



Not loud. Not defensive.



Just grounded in real experience.



YOU'RE NOT FRAGILE ONLINE



Reddit can be brutal.



Blog comments can be snarky.



Someone will say:

“SGEN is just another startup that’ll be dead in a year.”



You don’t panic.

You don’t rage-reply.

You don’t disappear.

You respond with clarity and calm.



Because you know the difference between criticism and noise.



WHAT YOU'LL ACTUALLY DO



You’ll dive deep into SGEN.



You’ll build test sites. Break things. Explore edges.



You’ll document:

- The first-click experience

- The confusing parts

- The missing explanations

- The friction



Then you’ll write:



Clear documentation.

Step 1. Step 2. Screenshot. Expected result.



Blog posts that actually say something.

Not filler. Not fluff. Not SEO sludge.



Comparison pages that feel honest.

Guides that prevent support tickets.

Reddit answers that genuinely help someone.



You’ll publish consistently. Weekly. Reliably.

Because content works through rhythm, not bursts.



WHAT MATTERS MOST

Native-level written English.

Not technically correct — natural.



When someone in the US reads your writing, they shouldn’t think,

“Oh, this was written overseas.”



They should think,

“This person gets it.”



You’ve built WordPress sites for at least 2 years.

Not theory. Not tutorials. Real clients. Real mess.



You understand:

- Plugin conflicts

- Theme weirdness

- Hosting nightmares

- Security scares



And when you write about them, it’s fro
mory — not Google.



You can write both:

- A bold opinion piece

 and

- A precise technical guide.



You understand basic SEO — not in a spammy way, but structurally.

You know what helps content rank without making it unreadable.



You can screenshot. Screen record. Annotate.

Because visual tools deserve visual documentation.



And most importantly:



You edit yourself.



You don’t ship first drafts.



You refine. Tighten. Clarify. Simplify.



THIS IS PROBABLY YOU IF...

- You’ve written long Reddit answers “just to help.”

- You’ve explained technical concepts to non-technical clients without making them feel dumb.

- You secretly enjoy reorganizing messy documentation.

- You get frustrated when products don’t explain themselves properly.

- You’ve thought, “I could write this better.”



WHAT THIS ROLE IS NOT



This is not generic content writing.

This is not keyword stuffing.

This is not pumping out 1,500 words of fluff twice a week.



We’re not looking for a writer who Googles technical topics.



We’re looking for a technical person who writes.



WHY THIS ROLE MATTERS



Great content doesn’t just bring traffic.

It builds trust.



It reduces support tickets.

It converts skeptics.

It makes a product feel mature.



A mediocre hire in this role will quietly weaken the brand.

The right hire will compound value every single week.



Are you the one we're looking for?

 your resume and portfolio to "phhr at seoguarantee dot com" with the subject line: Your Name – Technical Content Lead at Your Service.



COMPENSATION

For the right person in the Philippines with real WordPress experience and strong US-facing writing ability, this role ranges roughly from $1,200–$2,500 USD/month, depending on depth of experience and portfolio quality.



We will not underpay for excellence.



Because excellent content pays for itself.



If you’re reading this and thinking:

“They just described my career path.”

 “They’re describing the frustrations I’ve had.”

 “They’re describing how I write.”



Then maybe you’re not just interested.



Maybe you’re exactly who we’ve been looking for.



And we’d like to meet you.

title: UI UX Designer
description:
Must use 15 apply points to apply.



About Us

We are a digital marketing agency based in the US specializing in SEO, Google Ads, and
 Ads for clients in the construction, security, and real estate industries. We are a small, tight-knit team that values quality over quantity, clear communication, and people who take ownership of their work.



The Role

We are looking for a full-time website and page designer to own the visual design layer across all of our clients. Everything that goes on a client’s website starts with your design in Figma. You will be the person responsible for how every client’s website and strategic pages look before they go to development.



This is a dedicated, full-time position. We are not looking for freelancers juggling multiple clients. We need someone who is fully committed to our team and available during working hours.



What You’ll Be Doing

• Website design for all clients — homepage redesigns, new website builds, landing page designs, and any other page design work. All designs live in Figma.

• Strategic page design — pillar pages, service pages, and city/geo landing pages. These are high-impact pages that drive SEO rankings and conversions. You will create design templates per client for each page type so new pages can be produced efficiently while staying visually consistent.

• Design QA — after the developer builds your designs, you review the live build against your Figma to make sure everything matches. You catch what’s off before it goes live.

• Conversion optimization — you design with conversions in mind. CTA placement, visual hierarchy, form positioning, and trust signals. When data shows a page isn’t converting, you’ll adjust the design based on what the SEO strategist flags.

• Social media graphics — static post designs for client social media accounts. Consistent brand design across platforms.

• Collaboration — you’ll work closely with our content writer, SEO strategist, and developer. Communication happens in Slack and you’re expected to be responsive during working hours.

Requirements

• Proficient in Figma — this is our primary design tool. Everything you create lives here.

• Website design experience — you understand layout, spacing, typography, and how to design pages that look professional and convert visitors into leads.

• Mobile-first design — every design must account for both desktop and mobile. This is non-negotiable.

• Attention to detail — pixel-level precision matters. When you hand off a design to development, it should be clean and complete.

• Strong communication — you respond promptly in Slack, ask questions when something is unclear, and flag issues before they become problems.

• Reliable and consistent — you show up, you meet deadlines, and you don’t need to be chased for updates.

• Able to take direction and also think independently — we’ll give you briefs and feedback, but we also want you to bring your own design perspective and speak up when you see something that could be better.



Nice to Have

• Experience designing for WordPress or Elementor-based websites

• Understanding of basic SEO principles (headings, CTAs, page structure)

• Experience creating infographics or data visualizations

• Familiarity with brand identity and style guide creation



What We Offer

• Fixed monthly salary — no tracking hours, no guessing what your paycheck will be. Stable, predictable income every month.

• Long-term position — we are not hiring for a project. We want someone who grows with the team.

• Clear role and ownership — you own the design layer across every client. Your work is valued and visible.

• Small team, real impact — you’re not a number. Your input matters and your work directly affects our clients’ results.

• Room to grow — as we expand social media and take on new clients, your role and responsibilities will grow with the agency.



How to Apply

Do not send your resume as I am not interested in that but your work. 



• A link to your portfolio or Figma projects showing website design work (not just logos or social media graphics — we need to see full page designs)

• A brief message telling us about your experience and why you’re a good fit

• Your availability to start



Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

title: Australian GST Bookkeeper – Xero Reconciliation Project (Partnership + Company)
description:
I'm an Australian business owner looking for an experienced Xero bookkeeper with strong knowledge of the Australian tax system to reconcile 18 months of transactions across two separate entities — a partnership (tied to a personal ABN) and a Pty Ltd company. Both entities are GST registered and operate in professional services.

This is a project-based role with a clear path to regular ongoing work if you do a great job.



The Scope

The company generates roughly 5–10 transactions per day. The partnership generates 1–3 per day. Neither entity has been reconciled — we're starting from scratch across approximately 18 months. In total you're likely looking at 3,000–5,000+ transactions across both files.

Your job is to get both Xero files clean, correctly categorised, and ready for my BAS agent to review and lodge. You do not need to lodge anything yourself.



Specifically you will:



Reconcile all bank transactions across both Xero entities from the start

Categorise expenses to the correct accounts using the right Australian chart of accounts

Apply correct GST tax codes (GST, GST-free, BAS excluded, input-taxed) to all transactions

Proactively identify and flag legitimate business expenses that can be claimed — I want to make sure nothing is missed

Flag any transactions you're unsure about so I can clarify — I'm available for questions throughout

Deliver both files in a state where my BAS agent can go straight to lodgement without cleaning up behind you



What I'm Looking For



Minimum 3 years experience bookkeeping for Australian clients or working within an Australian accounting firm or BPO

Deep understanding of Australian GST — not just how to apply codes, but knowing what's claimable and what isn't for a professional services business

Xero proficient — bank reconciliation, tax codes, chart of accounts, and working across multiple separate organisations

Someone who works independently but communicates clearly when they have questions

Detail-oriented — I'd rather you ask than guess



Screening Question — Required

Applications without this will not be considered.

In your own words, explain: what is GST, how does it apply to a registered Australian business, and what is a BAS? Also briefly describe how you would approach reconciling a Xero file that has had no reconciliation done from the start.



To Apply Include:



Your CV with specific Australian clients or firms you've worked with

Your answer to the screening question above

Your proposed project rate (fixed fee preferred, or hourly with an estimated total)

Your availability and how quickly you could start





What Happens After You Apply

Shortlisted candidates will be given a small paid test task — approximately 20–30 sample transactions to categorise. This is paid and takes around 30–60 minutes. It's the fastest way for both of us to know if it's a good fit before committing to the full project.

Strong performers on this project will be offered regular ongoing bookkeeping work.

Posting consistency

Growth optimization

We want initiative.

Write high-retention hooks & captions

Schedule and publish content on time

Adapt quickly to new strategy shifts

Proven experience growing Instagram pages (must show proof/screenshots)

Strong short-form editing skills (CapCut, Premiere, etc.)

Posting consistency

Performance-based continuation.



???? To Apply (READ CAREFULLY)

ntum

title: IT Business Analyst (Philippines Only)
description:
You may apply using this link:  



About Us



Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company providing internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to successful real estate agents across the country. We are seeking an outgoing, tech savvy individual to join our growing team.



 



Why work for Ylopo?



At Ylopo we offer tea
mbers:



a commitment to personal development,



guidance and support at a high level through interfacing with our Executive Team to prioritize goals as a company,



excellent leadership and mentoring for our entry-level to senior staff, and recognition of outstanding efforts,



team building events, team lunches/ happy hours, and other company wide events



a supportive, caring environment dedicated to continuous learning and growth.



Ylopo is seeking a sharp, solutions-driven IT Business Analyst to help transform business needs into clear, actionable requirements. If you're passionate about documentation, testing, and process optimization, and thrive in collaborative, fast-paced environments, this is your chance to make an impact. Work closely with developers and stakeholders to drive clarity, alignment, and continuous improvement across our projects.



Job Description:



Gather, document, and validate business requirements by eliciting, analyzing, and specifying the underlying business needs and compiling them into a Business Requirement Document (BRD).

Closely work with the developers and stakeholders to ensure alignment on requirements.

Tracks and manages the requirements' status across the entire project lifecycle, including necessary enforcement or redefinition.

Write test scripts, execute and document Systems Integration Testing (SIT), log identified defects, and collaborate with developers to implement solutions.

Support User Acceptance Testing (UAT). 

Evaluate business processes, identify areas for improvement and develop and implement effective solutions based on process evaluations.

Assist/Lead ongoing reviews of business processes and develop optimization strategies, identify opportunities for process improvements and automation.

Develop and maintain process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to guide the project team. Effectively communicate complex information through simple, easily understandable visuals.

Conduct end-user training, process walkthroughs and reporting overviews.

Handle spot requests and assist with any other ad hoc duties assigned.

 



Qualifications/Skills:



Must have 2+ years of experience as IT Business Analyst

Excellent documentation skills, coupled with strong communication, presentation, and written abilities. Must also possess a strong team work spirit.

Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.  

Strong analytical, conceptual thinking, and problem-solving skills are essential. Must be meticulous and capable of clearly understanding, de-complicating, and proposing improvements to business requirements for project stakeholders.

Highly self-motivated, directed, can work independently with minimum assistance.

Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.

Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle and experience in Agile project delivery will be an advantage.

Proficiency in SQL scripting is a must.

Strong understanding and experience with Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) processes and Business Intelligence/Business Analytics (BI/BA) platforms is a plus.

 



System Requirements:



Processor should be 2 ghz and above, Intel core 5/7 or equal is highly required

MUST have the latest Operating System

      Windows 11 64bit

      Mac Ventura / Sonoma

16GB with 100GB Free disk space

MUST have a back-up Computer with the same specs as the main device

A Headset with noise cancelling feature is a must

20 mbps minimum wired connection for main isp

Back up internet is a must (pocket wifi, prepaid wifi etc. but strictly no USB Sticks allowed)

Back up power source

 



Shift Schedule: 8AM - 4PM Pacific Standard



Rate: depends on experience

title: Early intervention service coordinator
description:
Bright Future Kiddie Care – New York, NY

Full-Time / Part-Time



?



Job Overview



Bright Future Kiddie Care is seeking a dedicated Early Intervention Service Coordinator to support families with infants and toddlers (birth–3) who qualify for Early Intervention services in New York State. The Service Coordinator helps families navigate evaluations, IFSP meetings, service authorizations, provider communication, and ongoing progress monitoring.



This role is ideal for someone who is organized, compassionate, and enjoys working closely with families and interdisciplinary teams.



?



Key Responsibilities



Initial Service Coordination

 • Contact families referred to the Early Intervention Program

 • Explain the EI process, family rights, and service options

 • Assist families in scheduling evaluations

 • Gather medical, developmental, and social history



Ongoing Service Coordination

 • Participate in the development and review of the Individualized Family Service Plan (IFSP)

 • Ensure that all authorized EI services begin in a timely manner

 • Maintain ongoing communication with providers, evaluators, and families

 • Monitor service delivery and ensure services match the IFSP



Family Support

 • Help families access community resources (e.g., WIC, SNAP, housing supports, mental health services)

 • Provide guidance, emotional support, and advocacy

 • Ensure families understand their rights and procedural safeguards



Documentation & Compliance

 • Maintain accurate service notes and progress documentation

 • Submit all paperwork within required timelines

 • Utilize the NYS EI data system (e.g., NYEIS or EI-Hub)

 • Ensure compliance with NYSDOH Early Intervention regulations



Coordination of Meetings

 • Schedule and participate in IFSP meetings

 • Assist with annual and 6-month reviews

 • Help families transition from EI to CPSE (age 3)



?



Qualifications

 • Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in:

 • Social Work

 • Psychology

 • Early Childhood Education

 • Human Services

 • Nursing

 • Public Health

 • Related fields

 • Experience working with families and young children (preferred)

 • Strong communication, organization, and time-management skills

 • Ability to work independently and manage multiple cases

 • Must pass background checks and complete NYSDOH-required trainings



?



Skills & Competencies

 • Compassionate and family-centered

 • Knowledge of early childhood development

 • Ability to multitask and manage deadlines

 • Strong writing and documentation skills

 • Comfortable conducting home visits and virtual meetings

 • Familiar with community resources



?



What We Offer

 • Competitive pay

 • Flexible schedule

 • Training and ongoing professional development

 • Supportive and collaborative team environment

 • Opportunity to grow within Bright Future Kiddie Care’s expanding agency

title: Operations & Inventory Manager – Piano Industry E-Commerce (Advanced Excel Required)
description:
JOB TITLE

Operations & Inventory Manager – Piano Industry E-Commerce (Full-Time Remote)



ABOUT US

We are a U.S.-based specialty supplier serving piano technicians, schools, and institutions nationwide. We sell technical tools, parts, and supplies through e-commerce platforms and direct distribution.



This is a systems-driven business. Precision, inventory control, and purchasing discipline matter.



We are hiring a high-level Operations & Inventory Manager to take ownership of purchasing decisions, inventory health, and operational performance.



This is a leadership role, not a task-based assistant role.



WHO THIS ROLE IS FOR



• You think in systems, not tasks

• You are comfortable making purchasing decisions

• You enjoy working with data and spreadsheets

• You have managed people before

• You are comfortable being accountable for numbers



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



Inventory & Purchasing Ownership

• Monitor stock levels and reorder points

• Create and issue purchase orders

• Manage supplier communication

• Improve inventory turnover

• Reduce stockouts and overstock



Operational Oversight

• Coordinate with U.S. warehouse staff

• Track fulfillment accuracy and order speed

• Build and maintain SOPs

• Identify inefficiencies and fix them



Team Leadership

• Manage Filipino tea
mbers

• Set performance expectations

• Provide weekly KPI reporting



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE



• 3+ years in operations, supply chain, or inventory management

• Advanced Excel / Google Sheets

• Experience creating dashboards or KPI reports

• Strong written and spoken English

• Experience making purchasing decisions



COMPENSATION



$12–$16 per hour depending on experience

Performance-based bonus available



APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS



IMPORTANT: In the first line of your application, write “Precision & Tempo”.



Include:



A 3–5 minute Loom video explaining a purchasing or inventory system you managed.



Your expected monthly salary in USD.



Answers to the questions below.



SCREENER QUESTIONS



How do you determine how much inventory to reorder?



What KPIs would you track in a warehouse operation?



Describe a time you reduced stockouts or excess inventory.



A supplier raises prices 12%. What steps do you take before issuing your next purchase order?



What Excel formulas do you use most frequently?

title: Accessibilty Specialist (Documents / PDFs)
description:
This role requires advanced accessibility expertise and attention to detail, rather than general graphic design capability

alone. The specialist supports the remediation and production of complex documentation to meet WCAG 2.2 AA and PDF accessibility standards, ensuring outputs are compliant, usable, and fit for purpose.



Key Responsibilities

• Produce high-end, accurate finished art across complex, long-form financial services documentation.

• Create accessible interactive form PDFs using Adobe InDesign and Acrobat.

• Remediate existing documents to meet WCAG 2.2 AA and PDF accessibility standards.

• Apply and validate correct tagging, reading order, alt text, structure, and logical document flow.

• Conduct screen reader testing and accessibility validation.

• Ensure all documents meet compliance requirements within regulated environments.

• Liaise with IVE stakeholders to clarify briefs and accessibility requirements.

• Maintain exceptional attention to detail and technical accuracy.



Essential Skills & Experience

• Experience working within corporate brand guidelines and compliance frameworks.

• Advanced Adobe InDesign skills — complex layouts, long-form documents, print and digital production.

• Proven experience creating accessible interactive PDFs in InDesign and Acrobat.

• Strong working knowledge of WCAG 2.2 AA and PDF accessibility standards.

• Demonstrated experience remediating documents for accessibility compliance.

• Confident conducting screen reader testing and validating tagging, reading order, alt text and document structure.

• Experience working with regulated or financial services documentation highly regarded.



Accreditations & Desirable Skills

• Accessibility accreditations or formal accessibility certifications.

• Familiarity with Common Look PDF or other remediation tools.

• Proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint for document formatting.



***Work from home ready

***Amenable to work around 6AM-3PM //7 AM-4PM MNL time

***Comfortable using time tracker (time doctor app)



Interested applicants may send their most updated CV and portfolio. Apply now!

title: AML Consultant (Full time, Remote Work)
description:
AML Consultant

Location: Philippines

Type: Full time, remote

Contract: 8 months fixed term



We are a growing and collaborative compliance team supporting regulated businesses across multiple jurisdictions. We are looking for an experienced AML Consultant based in the Philippines to join us on an 8 month fixed term contract, with the possibility of extension depending on business needs at the time.



This is a full time, fully remote role offering strong team support, meaningful work, and ongoing learning opportunities.



What you will be doing

- Assisting with the development and review of AML risk assessments

- Drafting, updating, and maintaining AML policies, procedures, and related compliance documentation

- Translating regulatory requirements into clear, practical written materials

- Supporting compliance frameworks aligned to New Zealand and Australian AML legislation

- Collaborating with internal stakeholders to ensure documentation is accurate, consistent, and fit for purpose



What we are looking for

- Proven experience working in AML or financial crime compliance

- Strong understanding of AML legislation and regulatory expectations

- Demonstrated experience with risk assessments and policy or procedure writing

- Excellent written communication skills with the ability to produce clear, structured documents

- Strong attention to detail and analytical thinking

- Ability to work independently in a remote environment while engaging effectively with a distributed team



What we offer

- Full time remote work from the Philippines

- A supportive team environment with access to guidance and peer review

- Exposure to complex and meaningful AML work across multiple jurisdictions

- Ongoing learning and professional development opportunities

- Possibility of contract extension based on business needs



If you enjoy structured thinking, clear writing, and building strong compliance foundations, we would love to hear from you.

title: Senior AML Consultant
description:
Senior AML Consultant (Remote, Philippines-based)



Benefits and Perks

• Join a fast-growing consultancy with clients across Australia, New Zealand, and the UK

• Fully remote role based in the Philippines

• Collaborative and supportive leadership team invested in your continued development

• Flexible working hours to support work-life balance

• Opportunities for professional growth and progression



About the Role

As a Senior AML Consultant, you will play a key role in delivering independent AML audits, advisory engagements, and compliance reviews for a diverse portfolio of clients. You will work closely with a wider team of consultants based across Australia and New Zealand and will take ownership of client deliverables with support from senior leadership where needed.



This is an exciting opportunity for someone with existing AML/CTF experience who is ready to step into a more senior, consultative role. You’ll be responsible for managing engagements end to end, contributing to internal improvement initiatives, and mentoring junior tea
mbers from time to time.



Strong English communication skills – both written and verbal – are essential, as you’ll be engaging directly with clients and preparing high-quality reports and advisory material.



Key Responsibilities

• Lead and support AML/CTF audits and reviews across a range of industries

• Prepare reports and deliver findings to clients in a clear, professional manner

• Provide practical advisory support tailored to client obligations and risk profiles

• Collaborate with internal tea
mbers and contribute to best practice improvements

• Mentor junior consultants and support their development where applicable



Skills and Experience

• 3+ years’ experience in AML/CTF compliance, risk, audit or consulting roles

• Excellent spoken and written English

• Strong understanding of AML/CTF frameworks in Australia and/or New Zealand

• High attention to detail and analytical thinking

• Confidence engaging with stakeholders and managing client relationships remotely

• A relevant degree or qualification

• An AML/CTF certification (e.g. CAMS, CFCS) is preferred but not essential

• Experience in a consulting or client-facing environment is highly regarded



About the Company

We are a specialist AML consultancy providing audit and advisory services to clients across Australia, New Zealand, and the UK. Our clients include organisations in the legal, crypto, accounting, financial services, and real estate sectors. Operating as a remote-first business, we welcome professionals based in the Philippines who are looking to apply their expertise in an international consultancy environment.



Why Join Us?

We’re building a culture based on trust, accountability, and collaboration. As a growing team, we encourage you to contribute ideas, take ownership of your work, and help shape the future of the business. You’ll be supported by an experienced leadership team and given the flexibility to thrive in a remote working environment.

title: [Quick Placement] Reliable VA Receptionist Full Time Remote
description:
Important: Our application process moves quickly. If you are selected to proceed to the next interview stages, you must be able to respond promptly. Candidates who do not respond in a timely manner may be passed over.



We are currently seeking a Remote Spa Receptionist to manage inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based position. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Continued placement in this role depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, reliable attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, quick response times, and the ability to professionally manage complaints and de-escalate dissatisfied clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them into your reply, and answer each question thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.
