title: Meta Ads & Automation Assistant
description:
I run a growing life insurance lead generation company that manages Meta ad campaigns, automation systems, and lead distribution for life insurance agents. I already know how to do everything listed below, I’m hiring because we are scaling and I need a reliable, long-term VA to help manage and maintain systems. Someone that will grow with the company and help manage future VA teams.



This role combines Meta Ads support, GoHighLevel automation, 
 scenarios, and client management. While finding someone that can do all of these would be a huge help, I understand it is a lot to ask for. So, I am mostly looking for someone that can take the most amount of these tasks off my hands, however much possible.



You will be working directly with me and inside our team 
.



What You’ll Be Doing



Meta Ads Support

 • Assist with creating and managing Meta ad campaigns

 • Set and monitor daily budgets, spending limits, and caps

 • Understand campaign structure (CBO, ABO, testing vs scaling)

 • Work with Andromeda experience (preferred)

 • Flag issues like high CPLs, rejected ads, or pacing problems

 • Coordinate with our designer/VA on ad creatives and copy



Automation & Systems

 • Build and manage GoHighLevel automations

 • Create and maintain 
 (Integromat) scenarios

 • Send alerts when:

 • Clients are low on ad spend

 • Campaigns start/end

 • Leads hit certain thresholds



 Integrate:

 • Meta

 • GHL

 • 

 • Google Sheets reporting

 • Assist with LeadProsper lead distribution

 • Potentially help migrate some lead flows from LeadProsper into GHL



Bonus (Not Required but Big Plus)



Lead Distribution Experience

 • Insurance or Financial Services Background



Client Management Experience

 • Send and manage client invoices

 • Track ad spend and balances

 • Help answer basic questions in team 

 • Assist with troubleshooting and internal documentation



Team Management Softwares

 • 
, ClickUp, etc...



Who This Role Is For

 • You are technical, not just task-based

 • You understand marketing systems, not just clicking buttons

 • You can follow processes and help improve them

 • You are comfortable learning and asking questions

 • You want long-term, stable work, not short gigs



Who This Role Is NOT For

 • Beginners with no Meta Ads or automation experience

 • People who need step-by-step hand-holding forever

 • Anyone juggling too many clients already



Required Skills

 • Meta Ads Manager experience

 • GoHighLevel (workflows, triggers, pipelines)

 • 
 (Integromat)

 • Basic Google Sheets

 • 
 communication

 • Strong English reading & writing

 • Attention to detail



Hours & Growth

 • Starting part-time (10–20 hrs/week)

 • Opportunity to grow into full-time

 • Pay increases based on responsibility and performance

 • Long-term role, I want ONE person that can become my right-hand, not turnover



How to Apply



In your application, please answer:

 1. What tools from this job have you used hands-on?

 2. Which part of this role are you strongest in?

 3. Have you worked with Meta Ads budgets and caps before?

 4. Are you looking for long-term work?



Applications that don’t answer these will be skipped.

title: HR Generalist/Recruiter (Virtual Assistant Recruitment)
description:
Please provide a CV Resume with your submission. 



Working Hours: 10 AM - 6 PM CST



Company Overview:

MV Corporate is a growing and dynamic company dedicated to providing top-tier Virtual Assistant (VA) solutions for various divisions, including property management, real estate acquisitions, digital marketing, and administrative support. As we expand, we are seeking a highly motivated HR Generalist/Recruiter to join our team and take charge of sourcing, hiring, and onboarding Virtual Assistants to support our company’s growth. This role will also focus on developing strategies to retain top talent and ensure a high-performing VA team.





Position Overview:

The HR Generalist/Recruiter will be responsible for managing the end-to-end recruitment process for Virtual Assistants while also focusing on talent retention and department structuring. This individual will be responsible for creating SOPs for the HR department, improving HR processes, and implementing new strategies to keep and develop top talent. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the VA talent market, experience in full-cycle recruiting, and the ability to identify candidates who align with our company culture and goals.





Key Responsibilities:

Recruitment & Talent Acquisition:

Develop and execute recruitment strategies to source top-tier Virtual Assistants for various roles, including administrative support, marketing, real estate, and property management.

Post job listings on relevant job boards, social media platforms, and recruitment channels.

Screen resumes, conduct initial interviews, and shortlist qualified candidates for final review.

Manage the interview and hiring process, ensuring smooth communication between candidates and hiring managers.

Conduct reference checks and background verifications as needed.

Maintain an up-to-date candidate pipeline to meet the company's ongoing VA hiring needs.

HR, Onboarding & SOP Development:

Create and implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) for the HR department to streamline recruitment, onboarding, and HR processes.

Coordinate the onboarding process for newly hired Virtual Assistants, ensuring they have the necessary tools, training, and resources to succeed.

Develop and maintain onboarding materials, company policies, and training documentation.

Assist in creating HR policies and procedures for the VA workforce.

Maintain employee records and HR databases, ensuring compliance with company policies.





Talent Retention & Employee Engagement:

Develop and implement new talent retention strategies to ensure we keep top-performing Virtual Assistants.

Plan and execute virtual team-building activities, training, and employee recognition programs.

Monitor employee performance and job satisfaction through regular check-ins and feedback loops.

Address employee concerns and provide support to improve engagement and productivity.

Continuously research and introduce best practices in remote workforce retention to enhance the work environment.





Qualifications:

Minimum of 3 years experience in HR, recruitment, or talent acquisition, preferably in a remote or virtual setting.

Strong understanding of the Virtual Assistant job market, particularly in real estate, property management, and digital marketing.

Experience creating and implementing SOPs for HR operations.

Knowledge of talent retention strategies and employee engagement best practices.

Experience managing full-cycle recruitment, from sourcing to hiring.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to assess candidates effectively.

Ability to work independently in a remote environment with minimal supervision.

Proficiency in HR tools, applicant tracking systems (ATS), and virtual communication platforms.

Reliable high-speed internet connection.

Familiarity with US time zones and ability to work 10 AM - 6 PM CST.



Bonus Skills:

Experience in HR operations, onboarding, and employee engagement initiatives.

Knowledge of labor laws and best practices for remote work and virtual teams.

Familiarity with GoHighLevel (GHL) or Zoho CRM is a plus.



Benefits:

Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.

Flexible working environment.

Opportunity to work with a fast-growing company and develop your HR career.

Professional development and growth opportunities.

title: Mortgage Loan Processor
description:
We’re seeking a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Mortgage Loan Processor with strong experience in mortgage processing and real estate transaction coordination. This role is ideal for someone who can confidently manage loan files and real estate timelines from application to closing while maintaining exceptional professionalism and client care. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and excel at keeping transactions smooth and compliant, we’d love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities

- Manage mortgage loan files from application through closing with full accuracy and compliance

- Review, verify, and organize borrower documents (income, assets, disclosures, credit, property details, etc.)

- Coordinate with borrowers, lenders, underwriters, title/escrow teams, real estate agents, and vendors

- Track and manage all transaction deadlines—inspections, appraisals, conditions, contingencies, and closings

- Prepare and maintain transaction documents, disclosures, checklists, and compliance files

- Handle client communication via phone,
, and text to provide updates, gather documents, and resolve issues

- Conduct lead generation tasks, outbound calls, and follow-ups to support business growth

- Perform client outreach and nurture communication to ensure a professional customer experience

- Identify potential issues early and proactively keep files moving forward

- Maintain clean records, CRM updates, calendars, and transaction logs

- Assist leadership with general administrative or real estate–related tasks as needed



Qualifications:

- Required: 2+ years of experience in mortgage loan processing

- Required: Experience as a Transaction Coordinator or in real estate transaction workflows

- Strong attention to detail with excellent accuracy in documentation and timelines

- Strong communication skills, including comfort with client calls and outreach

- Ability to multitask, stay organized, and manage multiple transactions simultaneously

- Knowledge of real estate processes, mortgage documents, disclosures, and compliance

- Proficiency in CRM systems, LOS platforms, digital file tools, and workflow software

- Preferred: Experience in U.S.-based real estate, lending, or property transactions



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume along with a brief introduction explaining your relevant experience and why you’re an excellent fit for this role.

title: Bookkeeper & Accounting Specialist
description:
Before applying, please watch this video: 



We are a rapidly growing real estate asset management company seeking an experienced, detail-driven Virtual Bookkeeper to join our team. This role is ideal for someone who understands the complexities of real estate accounting, thrives in a structured and process-oriented environment, and can independently manage financial records with precision. If you enjoy supporting multiple properties or business units and take pride in maintaining clean, accurate books, we’d love to hear from you.



Key Responsibilities:

- Maintain and manage financial records within QuickBooks, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance across all accounts

- Structure and refine account categories, subcategories, and classes—including building out custom classifications as needed

- Perform comprehensive bank and credit card reconciliations by comparing transactions across QuickBooks, bank statements, and vendor records

- Handle data entry for journal entries, payroll files, W9s, invoices, receipts, and all financial documentation

- Prepare, review, and analyze financial reports such as Profit & Loss statements, Balance Sheets, and property/entity-specific summaries

- Track, manage, and report income and expenses across multiple properties or real estate business units

- Create, post, and reconcile payments, invoices, bills, and vendor transactions

- Maintain a clean and accurate Chart of Accounts with ongoing updates to support operational needs

- Learn and utilize additional financial or reporting tools as the company expands

- Ensure all accounts remain up to date, including investor distributions, mortgages, insurance, utilities, vendors, and credit card payments

- Manage inventory, assets, and property-related financial records



Qualifications:

- Proven experience as a Bookkeeper—preferably in real estate, asset management, or property management

- Strong proficiency in QuickBooks (required) and solid grounding in accounting principles

- Exceptional attention to detail, accuracy, and consistency when handling financial data

- Ability to work independently, manage deadlines, and stay organized with minimal supervision

- Strong communication skills (written and verbal) with a proactive, problem-solving mindset

- Familiarity with real estate accounting best practices, industry standards, and compliance requirements

- Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (preferred but not required)

- Bookkeeping or accounting certifications (e.g., QuickBooks ProAdvisor) are a strong plus



To Apply:

Please submit your CV/resume along with a short video or audio introduction summarizing your experience and why you’re a great fit for this role.

title: Video & Podcast Editor – Long & Short-Form Content | URGENT HIRING
description:
Are you a creative storyteller with a passion for editing long-form YouTube videos and podcasts? Do you thrive on transforming raw content into polished, engaging pieces that keep audiences coming back for more?



We’re looking for a skilled Video & Podcast Editor to join our growing team at MV Corporate. You will play a central role in expanding our YouTube channel and launching a new podcast. While your primary focus will be on long-form content, you will also produce short-form highlights for TikTok, Instagram, and
 to extend our reach. This is an exciting opportunity to shape the future of our content strategy, work with creative freedom, and grow with a company that values innovation.



What You’ll Do:



In this role, you will edit long-form YouTube videos and podcast episodes that are polished, engaging, and aligned with our brand. You will enhance audio quality by balancing sound levels and removing background noise, and collaborate on episode flow, intros, outros, and visual overlays to keep viewers engaged. You will also repurpose long-form content into short-form clips for social media, use AI-powered tools to streamline workflow and elevate production quality, and design compelling thumbnails, banners, and visual assets that attract clicks and views. Additionally, you will manage scheduling and publishing through GoHighLevel (creative side only) and stay ahead of YouTube and podcast trends to ensure our content remains fresh and competitive.



What We’re Looking For:



The ideal candidate has strong proficiency in editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve, and CapCut, along with experience in audio editing using Adobe Audition. Familiarity with AI-powered editing tools like Descript, Runway, and Otter.ai is essential. A deep understanding of YouTube algorithms, SEO, and strategies for audience retention is required, as is the ability to create thumbnails, overlays, and storytelling elements that captivate viewers. Experience using GoHighLevel for scheduling content and the ability to manage multiple projects independently while meeting deadlines will set you apart.



Bonus Skills:



Applicants with knowledge of YouTube SEO and analytics to optimize performance, experience distributing podcasts on platforms such as Spotify, Apple Podcasts, or Google Podcasts, and familiarity with social media growth strategies for cross-promotion will have an advantage.





TO APPLY:

Send us your updated CV/resume and also you must provide us with proven portfolio showcasing long-form YouTube videos and podcast editing, a strong creative vision with storytelling skills that keep audiences hooked, and excellent communication and collaboration abilities.



Why Join Us?



At MV Corporate, you will be part of an innovative and supportive team that values creativity and growth. This role offers the opportunity to shape impactful content, enjoy creative freedom, and contribute to a channel and podcast with high growth potential, all while working in a fully remote environment.

title: Operations Assistant
description:
We are a fast-growing property management business based in Australia seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Operations Assistant to join our team. This role focuses on keeping things running smoothly behind the scenes and supporting our daily operations.



Key Responsibilities:

-Highly efficient with administrative tasks and organizational systems. Provide essential administrative assistance, including schedule management, meeting organization, and document handling, to ensure smooth daily operations

-Assist in collecting, organizing, and maintaining data and records crucial for operational decision making and reporting

-Identify operational improvement opportunities, streamline processes, and implement efficiency-enhancing solutions to optimize daily operations

-Collaborates well and communicates effectively across teams. Act as a communication bridge between internal and external stakeholders, ensuring timely information exchange among teams and clients

-Coordinate logistics, such as inventory management, supply ordering, and scheduling, to ensure resources are available for day-to-day operations

-Highly skilled in communications with contractors and tradespeople. Review list of contractors for our Melbourne operations while ensuring their availabilities and services are suitable for our portfolio.



Qualifications:

-Thrives in a fast-paced environment and adapts quickly to shifting priorities

-Strong organizational and time-management skills

-High attention to detail and problem-solving abilities

-Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

-A proactive attitude and a knack for staying one step ahead

-Experience in an operations or admin support role is a plus

-Willingness to be monitored via TimeDoctor (screenshots are taken randomly to track time and performance)



Work Schedule:

This role requires a commitment of 40 hours per week, 6am-2pm Philippine Time (Monday to Friday).



If you're interested, please send a link to your latest CV. We'll be in touch with the next steps if you are shortlisted.
salary: 6 AUD/hr, with an increase to 7 AUD/hr

title: Marketing Video Editor & Designer
description:
The ideal candidate will:

*Show competency in videography principles from scripting through final editing and show proficiency with branding guidelines using Adobe CS and video motion software such as Premier Pro, Motion, and/or After Effects, Premiere and Final Cut Pro in an Apple Mac environment.

*Pre-visualize and/or storyboard shot ideas based on scripts or project outlines.

*Perform non-linear editing using Final Cut or Adobe Premiere software and designs after effects as needed including motion graphics, layout, and animation

*Be able to select and use music to match the tone and style of the episode and story

*Be able to create various types of audio / video to tell stories across multiple platforms

*Be able to mix different media into a complete experience (video, graphics, music).

*Experience in typography, color, composition, compositing, key framing, and title design.

*Be detail-oriented and possess a sophisticated editing style

*Knowledge of social media and how to engage audiences on digital platforms in the public space is essential to this role

*Ability to work with a team directly in edit sessions to assess needs and meet project requirements.

*Properly maintain a digital archive

*Possess a strong attention to detail and time managements skills, and be an organized team player

*provide their own video and audio equipment



Job responsibilities include:

*Manage our podcast production schedule for Rosie Radio, including managing workflow; and capture, editing, and uploading of podcasts to various online channels (iTunes [Libsyn], YouTube, blog, etc)

*Play a highly collaborative creative role in structuring new ideas and managing production projects to completion

*Edit online content for YouTube and 
, including podcast episodes, storytelling videos, and how-to videos

*Create and produce marketing videos and PR videos, as needed

*Sourcing photos, stock video and audio as needed for projects

*Create all multimedia content for social (audio / video / design)

*Edit and upload footage and maintain video logs and media storage

*Create motion graphics for video

*Design online / social graphics for various projects



Qualifications

*Well-versed in Adobe Premiere, along with the rest of Adobe CC software (After Effects, Photoshop, etc)

*Experience creating media for social and the web

*Experience in storytelling via videography

*Knowledge of video codecs and encoding software

*Expertise with multicam editing

*A strong understanding of editing workflows and file structuring

*Ability to color correct and mix audio

*Knowledge and experience with video lighting and basic set setup



Tech Requirements:

Computer - at least i5 or equivalent with 8gb RAM

Internet Speed - At least 50 MBPS Download speed

Need to have professional editing software (Licensed Adobe Premiere)

title: Pinterest Manager
description:
HOW TO APPLY



If this opportunity feels like the perfect fit for you and you meet the job qualifications, we invite you to learn more about our HiEnd Accents team in the Philippines and submit your application here:







Please note: Only applications submitted via this link will be considered.



 Job Description



We’re hiring a Pinterest Manager to take full ownership of our Pinterest presence and turn it into a high-performing sales channel.



This role owns both organic Pinterest growth and Pinterest Ads performance, with a strong focus on turning Pinterest into a scalable paid acquisition channel.



This is not a generic social media role—we’re looking for someone who deeply understands how the Pinterest platform works, from its search algorithm and Smart Feed to pin formats, trends, and conversion paths. Your goal: drive meaningful traffic and sales from Pinterest through smart, strategic execution.



Mission Statement: Build and scale a Pinterest strategy that doesn’t just look good—but performs. You will grow impressions, increase outbound clicks, and **drive profitable revenue through both organic content and paid Pinterest campaigns.



Primary Responsibilities





Pinterest Organic Strategy & Execution



- Develop and execute a Pinterest-specific strategy rooted in platform best practices and SEO.

- Stay on top of Pinterest’s evolving algorithm, features (e.g., Idea Pins, video), and trends to keep us ahead of the curve.

- Use keyword research and SEO to craft high-converting titles, descriptions, and hashtags.

- Align Pinterest strategy with seasonal campaigns, product launches, and key retail 
nts.

- Build and maintain a structured Pinterest keyword library to support ongoing SEO efforts.

- Leverage Pinterest keyword insights to inform both organic content and paid targeting.



Pinterest Ads Strategy & Execution



- Plan, launch, and manage Pinterest ad campaigns to drive traffic, conversions, and revenue.

- Develop a full-funnel Pinterest strategy that integrates organic content and paid amplification.

- Own campaign structure across prospecting, retargeting, and catalog sales campaigns.

- Manage budgets, bids, and pacing to hit performance targets.

- Continuously test audiences, creatives, and campaign types to improve efficiency.

- Partner with the eCommerce and analytics teams to ensure proper tracking and attribution.

- Scale winning campaigns while maintaining target CPA/ROAS goals.



Content Creation & Scheduling



- Design and publish optimized pins (static, video, Idea Pins) that speak to our target customer and drive clicks.

- Build and maintain organized boards with strategic themes and branding.

- Manage publishing cadence based on performance data and best practices through Tailwind, Pinterest Scheduler, or similar tools.

- Ensure all pins are visually on-brand and aligned with HiEnd Accents’ positioning.



Performance Analytics & Optimization



- Track and report on KPIs weekly/monthly: outbound clicks, saves, conversions, CTR.

- Run A/B tests on creative, formats, and timing to improve pin performance.

- Continuously refine strategy based on what the algorithm favors and what drives the best ROI.

- Monitor and optimize for downstrea
trics such as assisted conversions and revenue contribution where available.

- Monitor competitor activity and emerging Pinterest trends within the home and interior space.



Cross-Functional Coordination



- Collaborate with our marketing, design, and eCommerce teams to align Pinterest with overall brand goals.

- Repurpose and adapt content for Pinterest from broader campaigns and launches.

- Identify and surface high-potential UGC or inspiration imagery for Pinterest use.



Requirements



- Have 2+ years of hands-on Pinterest Ads and organic Pinterest experience** for a brand or eCommerce business.

- Demonstrated experience managing Pinterest Ads Manager, including campaign structure, audience targeting, and bid optimization.

- Comfortable working with performance data, dashboards, and attribution reporting.

- Passion for interior design, home décor, or lifestyle brands preferred.

- Experience working with luxury, premium, or design-driven brands is a strong plus.

- Must be able to collaborate during overlapping US business hours as needed.

- Understand how Pinterest works as a visual search engine, not just a social platform.

- Have a strong portfolio or case studies that show you’ve driven real traffic and sales from Pinterest**.

- Are skilled with Pinterest SEO, keyword research, and algorithm-based strategies.

- Know your way around Tailwind, Canva, Photoshop, and Pinterest Analytics.

- Are detail-oriented, self-directed, and results-focused.

- Bonus: experience with affiliate marketing, *
 capture from Pinterest, or using Pinterest for DTC sales.

- Please include links to Pinterest accounts, boards, or case studies you have directly managed.



About HiEnd Accents



HiEnd Accents designs and creates everyday luxury bedding and linens, sheeting, decorative pillows and other home textiles. Founded in 2005 and based in Dallas, Texas, our mission is to elevate our customers' lives via beautifully designed home textiles that deliver quality and value.



As a family-owned business, we’re committed to personal service and long-term relationships. Through our four brands, we offer unique designs across a spectrum of styles and price points, all united by exceptional value. Combined with our customer-first approach, prompt shipping and low order minimums, we’ve become the preferred bedding supplier for thousands of top department stores, furniture retailers, interior designers, and boutique hotels nationwide. Recently recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing businesses in the US, we continue to innovate and expand our reach in the home textiles market.



Discover more about us and our brands at [
](
).



Want to get to know us better and learn what it’s like to be part of our growing team in the Philippines? Learn more here: 



Why HiEnd Accents?



At HiEnd Accents, we're a close-knit team driven by entrepreneurial spirit, growth mindset, and a shared commitment to excellence. Our collaborative approach has propelled us to new heights – we're proud to be recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing small companies in the United States. This achievement is a testament to our team's dedication and the exciting opportunities ahead. If you thrive in a vibrant, high-paced culture where your contributions truly matter, we want to hear from you!



Working at HiEnd Accents means that you can expect the following:



Competitive Compensation - We offer a highly competitive compensation package, including 13th Month Pay



Professional Growth - We invest in our people and make sure that they have the opportunity to continuously learn, grow, and develop their careers



Great Team of Like-Minded Professionals - We prioritize hiring based on culture and values, so you’re working with a team of folks who are as fun, talented, and committed as you are

title: Payroll & Financial Reporting Officer (Australia)
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Payroll & Financial Reporting Officer to support payroll processing and financial reporting across our childcare group. This role is suited to someone with strong payroll compliance knowledge, solid accounting and bookkeeping skills, and experience working across multiple entities.



The position manages payroll using Employment Hero and supports financial reporting in Xero, including BAS, GST reconciliation, intercompany bookkeeping, billing, and wages reporting.



Skills & Requirements

• Strong experience in end-to-end payroll processing.

• Strong knowledge of Australian payroll legislation, awards, and compliance requirements.

• Experience with ATO submissions related to payroll.

• Strong accounting and bookkeeping knowledge.

• BAS and GST reconciliation experience for group accounts (mandatory).

• Experience with intercompany bookkeeping and multi-entity reporting.

• Intermediate to advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivots, reconciliations).

• High attention to detail and accuracy.

• Experience with Employment Hero (Payroll) and Xero (Financial Reporting).

• Strong time management and communication skills.





Key Responsibilities



Payroll Processing (Employment Hero)

• Prepare and process end-to-end payroll for all staff within set deadlines.

• Manage payroll adjustments, corrections, and payroll-related enquiries.

• Ensure accurate calculation of wages, leave, allowances, and deductions.

• Maintain accurate payroll records in line with awards and legislation.



Payroll Compliance & ATO Submissions

• Ensure compliance with Australian payroll legislation, awards, and Fair Work requirements.

• Prepare and support ATO submissions related to payroll.

• Assist with payroll audits and compliance reviews as required.



Superannuation & Payroll Tax

• Process superannuation contributions accurately and on time.

• Prepare monthly payroll tax calculations and assist with lodgements.

• Reconcile payroll tax across entities and reporting periods.



Financial Reporting & Bookkeeping (Xero)

• Support financial reporting using Xero.

• Assist with BAS preparation and GST reconciliation for a group of entities (mandatory).

• Maintain accurate bookkeeping records across multiple entities.

• Support fortnightly bookkeeping and reconciliations.



Intercompany Bookkeeping & Billing

• Manage intercompany bookkeeping for staff costs, agency costs, and shared expenses.

• Record casual staff costs and agency costs to correct intercompany accounts.

• Maintain accurate intercompany journals, balances, and reconciliations.

• Support intercompany billing and complex cost allocations.



Wages, P&L & Management Reporting

• Prepare wages reports for management and finance teams.

• Support P&L and wages analysis across centres and entities.

• Assist with internal reporting to support budgeting and cost control.



Agency Invoicing

• Match agency invoices against approved timesheets and rates.

• Liaise with agencies to resolve discrepancies.



The role may transition to a full-time position, subject to performance, adherence to rostered hours, and maintaining 100% attendance.



The working days are Monday to Wednesday, from 9:00 am to 2:00 pm Sydney time (6:00 am to 11:00 am Philippine time). This may change in case the client asks you to come in on some other days or extend your working hours.



We are seeking someone with sound knowledge of Australian bookkeeping who can work independently and learn at their own pace. Video training materials and SOPs will be provided. You can always check in with the finance manager if you have any questions or require clarification regarding your work.

title: Experienced Digital Marketing (AU hours) - Longterm
description:
TITLE:

Digital Marketing Coordinator (aka; Advertising, Media & Communications Manager)



BUSINESS:

Our business is a dream to work for…

• We provide content promotion and lead generation to global personalities and professionals.

• Our focus (and soon to be your focus) is to help global personalities and professionals succeed by driving attention to their most powerful educational content and drive leads to their business to increase their sales. To do this, we recruit the best video editors, graphic designers, content writers, paid ad media buyers and more.



ROLE:

This role is perfect for you, if…

• You are looking to work in a role of an experienced Digital Marketing Coordinator

• You want to work on multiple clients marketing campaigns, working with media buyers/graphic designers/video editors/content writers

• You have confidence and enjoy speaking professionally with clients (written and verbal)

• You want to work remotely, full time (40 hours) a week - Monday to Friday

• You’re interested in Day Shift hours, during Melbourne, Australia business hours

• You have a University Level Education

• And, you already have advanced skills in building (or running) paid digital advertising campaigns



RESPONSIBILITIES:

Your responsibilities will include…

• Build and execute comprehensive project plans for marketing campaigns

• Coordinate with internal and external delivery teams, including clients, graphic designers, content writers, video editors, content writers, media buyers and developers

• Enforce end-to-end message congruency from the ad creative, ad copy, landing page copy, resource, etc

• Define the #1 pain point being solved by the campaign and ensure it hits the desired target market

• Identify project issues, roadblocks or missing requirements quickly and resolve proactively

• If necessary, re-write and optimise content - such as; ad copy, funnel copy,
 copy, etc

• Ensure a campaign has the highest chance of success prior to going live

• Document and handover all campaign, funnel and ad resources to media buyer for them to manage post go-live

We will provide training on how to execute each item above, as long as you are the type of person who has the will to learn and master it.



REQUIREMENTS:

To be considered for this position, you are required to:

• You need to have a proven solid work experience as a digital marketing coordinator of at least 2+ years

• You need to have a Computer/Laptop with at least i5 processor and 8gb of RAM

• You need to have a 2nd computer screen in your home office

• You need to have a fast and reliable Internet connection, with access to a back-up

• You have leadership abilities, decision-making skills, and problem-solving capabilities.

• You have proven experience as a content writer in lead generation, or project manager in a lead generation, or operated in a digital marketing environment.

• You have a results-driven mindset with a commitment to achieving project objectives.

• You have a strong attention to detail and highly organised

• You have a friendly, upbeat and team focused attitude

• Most importantly, you desire to learn and obtain new responsibilities



SOFTWARE & TOOLS:

• Zoom - video meetings (internal team and client communication)

• Loom - screen recording software (internal team and client communication)

• Slack - internal communication tool

• ClickUp - task management software

• Google
 (gmail)

• Google Sheets

title: Instagram Appointment Setter
description:
Join the Dream Team and Make a Difference



The Dream Team Academy is a leading online fitness coaching company with a global community of over 1.1 million followers. Our mission is to empower busy Filipino nurses to transform their lives, helping them lose weight, regain confidence, and build a healthier lifestyle without sacrificing the foods they love. We are looking for a highly motivated and emotionally intelligent Appointment Setter to join our remote team and play a key role in our growth.



Position: Appointment Setter

•Location: Remote (Philippines only)

•Schedule: Monday to Friday, 10:00 PM - 4:00 AM Manila Time



The Role

As an Appointment Setter, you will be the first point of contact for potential clients, engaging with them on social media to understand their goals and challenges. Your ability to build rapport and ask insightful questions will be crucial in identifying qualified leads and booking them for consultations with our coaching team. This is a vital role that directly contributes to our mission of changing lives.



Key Responsibilities

•Engage with prospective clients on Instagram and
 using our proven scripts and frameworks.

•Build trust and rapport through authentic, empathetic conversations.

•Ask strategic questions to qualify leads based on their goals, challenges, and readiness to commit.

•Book 4-5 highly qualified appointments daily with our expert coaching team.

•Maintain and organize lead information in our CRM system (e.g., Google Sheets).

•Nurture and follow up with warm leads to keep them engaged.

•Provide a concise end-of-day report summarizing key metrics and achievements.



Who You Are

•An Excellent Communicator: You have exceptional written English skills and can type quickly and accurately.

•A People Person: You are emotionally intelligent, empathetic, and can naturally build trust and connection through chat.

•A Proactive Learner: You are hungry to learn, open to feedback, and committed to personal and professional growth.

•Highly Organized: You can manage multiple conversations simultaneously without losing track of details.

•Results-Driven: You are motivated by targets and consistently strive to meet and exceed them.

•Experience (Preferred): Previous experience in appointment setting, lead generation, customer support, or chat-based sales is a significant advantage.

•Fitness Interest (A Plus): A passion for health and fitness is a bonus but not a requirement.



What We Offer

•Competitive Compensation: A generous base salary paid in USD, with attractive performance-based bonuses for exceeding targets.

•Career Growth: This is a stable, long-term position with a clear path for advancement into Senior Setter or Closer roles for high-performing tea
mbers.

•World-Class Training: You will receive comprehensive training on our proven scripts, systems, and processes, ensuring you have everything you need to succeed.

•Mentorship: Direct mentorship and support from our experienced team of closers and setters.

•A Thriving Culture: Join a dynamic, international team that is passionate about making a positive impact on people's lives.



How to Apply

If you are ready to take on this rewarding challenge and grow with us, please follow these steps to apply:

title: QA Tester
description:
QA Tester (Contract) – Join the Dream Team at Built Simple



Welcome to the dream team. At Built Simple, we're building construction software from the ground up to make building simple for builders, with tools for estimating, scheduling, and project management that take the load off admin.



We're part of a multidisciplinary group of businesses that includes CJ Advisory (bookkeeping & tech consulting) and CareAbout (Australia's leading aged care placement service). Across all of them, we move fast, build with cutting-edge AI tools, and ship features at startup speed.



But speed without quality is just chaos. That's where you come in.



The Role



We're looking for an experienced QA Tester on a contract basis, someone we can call on to thoroughly test new features, hunt down bugs, and make sure everything works before it hits our users.



We build fast using AI-powered development tools, which means new features land constantly. Your job is to make sure nothing slips through the cracks. You'll be the last line of defense before our users see anything, and you'll be critical to us confidently launching our product.



This is a flexible, ongoing contract, workload will vary depending on development cycles. Some weeks will be busy with feature releases and launch testing; other weeks may be lighter. We're looking for someone who can be responsive when needed and is happy with a variable workload. For the right person, there's potential for this to grow into a longer-term or more regular arrangement as the product scales.



This isn't just "click around and see what happens." We need someone who thinks systematically, documents thoroughly, and can test across different devices, browsers, operating systems, and user scenarios. If you find a broken button before a customer does, you've done your job.



What You'll Be Doing



-Manually test web app and mobile app features across multiple browsers, devices, and operating systems

-Create and maintain detailed test cases and test plans for new and existing features

-Perform regression testing after releases to ensure existing functionality still works

-Log bugs with clear, reproducible steps, screenshots, and device/browser details

-Test across different user roles, permissions, and real-world scenarios

-Verify fixes and track issues through to resolution

-Work closely with the development team to communicate issues and priorities

-Help build and maintain our QA checklists and documentation

-Identify patterns in recurring bugs (hardware-specific, browser-specific, user-type-specific)

-Support exploratory testing - actively try to break things in ways real users would



You'll Thrive Here If You…



-Have a sharp eye for detail and a low tolerance for "it's probably fine"

-Think like a user - you can anticipate how different people on different devices will interact with software

-Are methodical and organised in how you document and track issues

-Communicate clearly - your bug reports are so good a developer can reproduce the issue in minutes

-Have experience testing web applications and mobile apps (iOS and Android)

-Understand cross-browser and cross-device testing (Chrome, Safari, Firefox, Edge - desktop and mobile)

-Are familiar with bug tracking tools (e.g., 
, Jira, or similar)

-Can jump in quickly when needed and turn around testing within agreed timeframes

-Are reliable and responsive - when we need you, we need to know you're available



Nice to Have (But Not Required)



-Experience with test automation tools (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, or similar)

-Familiarity with developer tools (browser console, network tab) to help diagnose issues

-Understanding of responsive design and how apps should behave across screen sizes

-Experience in a startup or fast-paced environment where things change quickly



How This Works



-Contract basis - paid hourly or per testing cycle, depending on what works best

-Workload will vary, we'll give you as much notice as possible when testing is needed

-You'll need your own devices for testing (we can discuss specifics)

-We communicate primarily via Slack and 

-Australian business hours overlap preferred but not required for every task



Important



This is a contract role, not a full-time position but we're looking for someone who wants to build a long-term working relationship with us. We want a go-to person we can rely on, not a one-off freelancer.



If you're already juggling too many clients to be responsive when we need you, this probably isn't the right fit. We need someone who can prioritise our work when testing cycles come up.



What We Offer



-Flexible, ongoing work with a fast-moving team

-The chance to shape QA processes from the ground up

-Work with modern AI-powered development tools and workflows

-Potential to grow into a more regular or permanent role as the product scales

-A team culture built on curiosity, accountability, and fun

title: Executive Assistant / Project Manager
description:
We’re hiring a highly organized, systems-minded Team Admin / Executive Assistant / Project Manager to support leadership and keep the team operating smoothly.



This role is for someone who thinks in systems, spots gaps before they become problems, stays ahead of deadlines, and keeps the entire team aligned without needing constant supervision. You are here to support leadership, manage projects, and keep systems running smoothly so the rest of the team can focus on execution.



—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those “magic 
nts” where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does—every time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you think in priorities, timelines, and dependencies? Do you enjoy turning scattered ideas into structured plans with clear owners and deadlines? Are you the type who follows up before being asked and catches details others miss? Do you take pride in building clean systems, documenting processes properly, and keeping teams aligned without constant supervision?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Admin & Team Support

- Manage calendars, meetings, follow-ups, and reminders

- Handle inbox organization and message triage

- Prepare documents, trackers, and internal updates

- Keep files, folders, and naming systems clean and consistent



Project Management

- Track ongoing projects, deadlines, and dependencies

- Break down tasks and assign owners

- Follow up on deliverables and flag risks early

- Keep project boards and trackers up to date (e.g. Notion, Monday, ClickUp, Sheets)



Systems & Process

- Build and improve simple systems that reduce back-and-forth

- Document SOPs and workflows as things evolve

- Spot inefficiencies and automation opportunities, and suggest, design, and implement improvements

- Maintain dashboards, trackers, and recurring reports



Communication & Coordination

- Act as the bridge between leadership and the team

- Clarify priorities and next steps after meetings

- Ensure instructions are understood and executed correctly

- Keep everyone aligned without micromanaging



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Extremely detail-oriented

- Strong written communication

- Comfortable juggling multiple priorities

- Proactive. You don’t wait to be told something is broken, you anticipate it before it breaks.

- Excellent organizational skills

- Excellent time management skills

- Must love creating, refining, and working with standard operating processes (SOPs)

- Experience with Google Suite and GoHighLevel CRM is a plus, but not required

- Must be willing to work long hours and be available to respond to messages within a 12-hour daily window (not necessarily working 12 hours a day, but reliably reachable and able to respond quickly if something urgent comes up).

- Project management experience and comfortable managing and driving multiple large projects

- Comfortable with outcome and goal-based delegation and does not need to be told individual tasks

- Must have extensive experience as an executive assistant, chief of staff, or operations associate

- Must have experience automating workflows and designing workflow processes with automation in mind. You may not be individually responsible for building them, but you should already have the experience to handle basic tasks and understand how the process works.

- Should be fluent in AI, but not reliant on it to think for you.

- Strong written and spoken English communication skills; near-native level preferred

- Extremely growth-oriented and hungry to learn.

- You are the type of person who follows through every single time, no matter what, and always gets the job done. No excuses, no matter what pops up

- You are the type of person who is delighted when the client or the person you're preparing something for is delighted

- You want meaningful work around people who are incredibly smart, hard-working, and dedicated, with a phenomenal culture. We work hard, but we have fun doing it together.

- Must have previous experience managing people. You may not have any direct reports, but the experience is important.

- Must move with a sense of speed and urgency in everything.







--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.





STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project, estimated to be 2-3 hours of work for each (a total of $20-40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Team Admin / Assistant / Project Manager with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Senior AU Tax Accountant
description:

title: Licensed MD/RN Needed — Curriculum Reviewer for  Integrative Health and Functional Medicine Course (Remote)
description:
THIS POSTING CLOSES IN 48–72 HOURS. We are filling the last remaining spot in our pool of Curriculum Reviewers for this course area.



AccrediPro University is an internationally accredited online certification platform with 5,000+ enrolled students. We are currently looking for one licensed professional with background in Integrative Health and/or Functional Medicine to join our team.



This is a fully remote, flexible collaboration — not a full-time job.



Integrative Health & Functional Medicine is a broad discipline. If your expertise falls within any of its areas — such as gut health, hormone health, autoimmune conditions, functional lab interpretation, clinical nutrition, among others — please specify your area(s) of focus when applying.



LICENSE FILTER:



•PH-MD (Licensed Physician) — PRIMARY

Ideal candidates hold an active PRC license as Medical Doctor with practice or training in integrative and/or functional medicine.



•PH-RN (Licensed Nurse) — CONDITIONAL

Registered Nurses will be considered only if they hold additional, verifiable certifications in Functional Medicine, Integrative Health, or Clinical Nutrition (e.g., IFM, AFMCP, or equivalent programs).



•PITAHC-registered practitioners — CONDITIONAL

Considered only if registered in disciplines directly relevant to integrative health (e.g., naturopathy, traditional medicine practice). Must provide certificate of registration.



All PRC licenses will be verified via 
. PITAHC credentials must be documented and verifiable.



ABOUT THE ROLE



A Curriculum Reviewer is a licensed professional who reviews, validates, and strengthens the authority of our already-certified courses by lending their name, credentials, and professional expertise.



What you'll do:

• Review course content within your area of expertise and provide professional input on accuracy and quality

• Be listed by name and credentials on course materials (e.g., "Curriculum reviewed by [Your Name], MD")

• Be included as a reviewing professional when AccrediPro submits courses to accreditation bodies (current partners include CMA, CTAA, IPHM, IHTCP, IIOHT, among others — AccrediPro actively pursues new accreditation partnerships on an ongoing basis)



Important: our courses are exclusively theoretical and educational. They do not grant clinical practice licenses and do not authorize diagnoses, prescriptions, or medical treatments.



COMPENSATION



Annual Entry Fee: $80 USD/year. This is paid to you as recognition of your professional credentials and for joining the AccrediPro Curriculum Reviewer team.



Additional Paid Tasks (on-call, per project): once onboarded as a Curriculum Reviewer, you become eligible for further paid assignments. Each task is compensated separately on top of the annual fee:



• Module-by-module course review — hourly rate ($4–5 USD/hour)

• Educational and case-study video production — fee per project

• Edutorial article publication (conferring CPD points) — fee per project

• Webinar speaker engagements — fee per project

• Audio podcast participation — fee per project



These opportunities are only available to active Curriculum Reviewers. You must hold the Curriculum Reviewer role first in order to access them.



HOW TO APPLY



Send a message with:

1. Your full name and PRC license number (or PITAHC registration / international credential details)

2. Your specific area(s) of expertise within Integrative Health and Functional Medicine

3. Link to your active LinkedIn profile (if available)

4. Any additional certifications or training — the more relevant qualifications you list, the stronger your application



Serious applicants only. We verify every credential before proceeding.

The ideal candidate has strong knowledge of bookkeeping principles, excellent analytical skills, and experience working with accounting software.



Key Responsibilities:



- Record and reconcile daily financial transactions, including sales, expenses, invoices, and payments



- Maintain accurate general ledgers and prepare monthly financial statements



- Oversee accounts payable and accounts receivable processes



- Monitor cash flow, budgets, and financial forecasts



- Prepare documents for tax filing, audits, and compliance requirements



- Ensure all financial data is accurate, organized, and up to date



- Collaborate with management on financial reporting and process improvements



- Create clean and presentable reports that can be easily understoon



Qualifications:



- Proven experience in bookkeeping or accounting for a E-commerce brand (At least 2+ years ) (Applications that do not have any experience working for E-commerce brands will automatically be rejected)



- Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting



- Proficiency with E-commerce P/L Tracking Apps



- Proficiency with accounting software (QuickBooks, Xero, or similar)



- Solid background working in Finance



- Excellent attention to detail, organization, and time management



- Ability to work independently and maintain confidentiality



- Strong communication and problem-solving skills



Work Environment:



This is an in-house role working directly with the operations and management teams to ensure the financial health and accuracy of the company’s books.

title: Product Creative Designer
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly creative and experienced Product Creative Designer to join our growing design team. In this role, you will be responsible for conceptualizing, ideating, sketching, and developing 3D models for innovative baby products that combine functionality, aesthetics, and emotional connection. You will drive early-stage product ideas — turning insights and trends into tangible concepts — and collaborate closely with our product and creative teams to bring these ideas to life.



This role requires strong conceptual thinking, aesthetic sensitivity, and technical product design skills. If you are passionate about designing purposeful baby products that make everyday parenting easier and more joyful, we would love to hear from you.



Note: Please see application instructions below.



Key Responsibilities:

• Conduct market and consumer research to identify trends, unmet needs, and product opportunities relevant to baby products.

• Generate creative and forward-thinking ideas through freehand sketching, moodboards, and visual ideation.

• Develop detailed 3D models and realistic renders that clearly communicate product form, ergonomics, and material intent.

• Collaborate with the Senior Designer, Creative, and Product Development teams to explore, refine, and finalize design directions.

• Translate abstract ideas and feedback into clear visual storytelling and refined design outputs.

• Support multiple design projects simultaneously, maintaining quality, accuracy, and alignment with brand standards.

• Use Photoshop, Illustrator, and 3D modeling tools (e.g., SolidWorks, Fusion 360) to visualize and present design concepts professionally.



Requirements:

• Minimum of 2 years of working experience in a relevant product design or industrial design role.

• A portfolio that highlights concept sketches, 3D visualizations, and final product outcomes — especially for consumer or baby-related products.

• Strong conceptual thinking — demonstrated ability to ideate and communicate design intent through clear hand sketches and storyboards.

• Creative, energetic, and passionate about the baby product industry with a focus on safety and ergonomics.

• Required proficiency in design software, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and 3D modeling skills (e.g., SolidWorks). 3D rendering skills is a plus.

• Demonstrates consistency in completing tasks on schedule and an ability to communicate clearly and professionally with the team.



General Guidelines:

• Please label your message with: "I want to be your next Product Creative Designer" as you message us.

• No moonlighting is allowed during work hours in this role.

title: Illustrator and Print Designer
description:
We are seeking a creative and talented designer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for coming up with patterns for textile products and assisting in other projects such as packaging and illustrations for baby/maternity industry. The designer will be expected to work collaboratively with our team to produce high-quality designs and assist in other design projects as and when required.



Responsibilities:

• Concept & Trend Innovation: Conduct research into baby/children's market trends, then conceptualize and develop innovative print themes, color palettes, and design directions that resonate with our audience and align with KeaBabies' brand, leveraging • AI tools for accelerated ideation and visual exploration.

• Original Illustration: Create engaging, unique, and high-quality illustrations specifically tailored for KeaBabies' range of baby and children's products, such as swaddles, blankets, and bibs.

• Print & Pattern Design: Design seamless repeat patterns and distinctive print layouts for diverse product applications, ensuring all designs are optimized for manufacturing processes.

• Packaging Design: Assist in developing compelling and functional packaging designs that are on-brand, protect the product, and significantly enhance the overall customer experience.

• Production Readiness & Quality: Ensure all designs are production-ready and technically sound, meeting high-quality standards. This includes preparing accurate files and maintaining organized project records.

• Market Insight & Adaptation: Continuously monitor industry trends, competitor designs, and consumer preferences within the baby/children's market to directly inform and elevate design decisions.



Job Details:

• Salary: USD 450 to USD 600 per month

• Working Hours: 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM (GMT+8)

• Working Days: Monday to Friday



Requirements:

• A Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Illustration, or a related field.

• Portfolio: A strong, diverse, and professional online portfolio is mandatory. It must clearly showcase exceptional illustration skills, a deep understanding of color theory, and the ability to create seamless repeat patterns. Examples relevant to the baby and children's product industry are highly preferred.

• Industry Knowledge: A deep understanding of current design trends, consumer preferences, and aesthetic styles within the baby and children's product market.

• Software Proficiency: Expertise in digital design software, including Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, and Procreate, along with other relevant illustration and design tools. Familiarity with and willingness to explore AI-powered design tools is highly valued.

• Communication & Collaboration: Excellent project management and communication skills. You should have a proven ability to work collaboratively with the team, clearly articulating design concepts and feedback.

• Adaptability: A demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment while maintaining high-quality output. This role requires you to be highly self-motivated, organized, and disciplined to manage projects and meet deadlines independently.



Take note of the following:

• Title your message: "I want to be your next Illustrator and Print Designer!"

• Share with us your experience on marketing print design and illustrations.

• Attach your resume and sample task answers in the
.

• No moonlighting is allowed during work hours in this role.

description:

Requirements:

title: Packaging Graphic Designer
description:
Job Summary:

We are a a young and dynamic growing E-commerce company focusing on baby and maternity products with customers based in the USA, Canada, and Europe. We are seeking a capable Packaging Graphic Designer to deliver positive results in packaging design. If you are looking for a challenging, rewarding, and fulfilling career, we welcome you to apply for the job below.



Key Responsibilities:

• Build packaging layouts on dielines (boxes, sleeves, labels, inserts, hang tags, stickers) using KeaBabies brand guidelines.

• Apply and format packaging content: approved copy, icons, benefit callouts, charts, barcodes/UPCs, product info, and required markings.

• Prepare print-ready files: correct bleed/safe zones, dieline alignment, CMYK setup, font handling (outline/package), linked images, and export specs.

• Create internal review mockups (clean 2D + simple 3D visuals) for quick approvals.

• Handle packaging updates and versioning quickly (pack count/size changes, language/copy updates, claim changes, retailer/Amazon variants, seasonal refreshes).

• Design occasional full-color packaging boxes for existing products (front/back/sides), keeping hierarchy clear and branding consistent.

• Maintain packaging templates and systems so new SKUs/variations stay consistent (type scale, grids, icon rules, layout logic).

• Organize and deliver final handoff packages to Product Development (clear file naming, folder structure, exports, and “final” version control).



Must-have requirements:

• Packaging design + production experience (consumer goods preferred), with ability to work from dielines.

• Strong understanding of print production basics:

1. bleed / safe zone / trim

2. CMYK vs RGB

3. exporting print-ready PDFs

4. font handling (outlining/packaging) + linked assets

• High attention to detail (typo-free, aligned layouts, consistent spacing, correct SKUs/info).

• Ability to execute both minimal / limited-ink e-commerce packaging, and full-color box designs for existing products when needed.

• Comfortable with fast iteration + versioning (counts, sizes, copy/claim updates, variants).

• Strong file hygiene: organized layers, naming conventions, clean exports, version control.

• Clear communication and ability to implement feedback quickly in an async remote workflow.

• Capability to use the following tools:

1. Adobe Illustrator

2. Adobe Photoshop + Acrobat



Nice-to-have, but optional:

• Working knowledge of InDesign

• Experience with Amazon/e-commerce packaging constraints (clarity-first layouts, compliance callouts)



Portfolio requirements:

• Portfolio showing packaging work (ideally includes at least: - one minimal/limited-ink style layout, and - one full-color box design)



Additional Information:

• Title your message: "I want to be your next Packaging Graphic Designer"

• No moonlighting is allowed during work hours in this role.

title: VoIP Technician ****Ex Ring Central Employees Welcome X** EX 8X8 Employees Welcome*******
description:
****YOU MUST SUBMIT A RESUME AND VOICE RECORDING IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR A POSITION****





We are a leading telecommunications solutions provider dedicated to delivering cutting-edge communication technologies to businesses of all sizes. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional service and innovative solutions to our clients, and we are looking for a talented Telecommunications Phone System Technician to join our team.



Position Overview:

As a Telecommunications Phone System Technician, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining telecommunications systems for our clients. We are seeking an experienced technician with a strong background in legacy systems like Nortel, Avaya, and NEC, as well as expertise in modern UCaaS (Unified Communications as a Service) solutions and VoIP phone systems such as RingCentral, 8x8, 3CX, and Nextiva.



Responsibilities:



Install, configure, and maintain legacy phone systems like Nortel, Avaya, and NEC EC.

Design and implement UCaaS solutions to meet client requirements.

Configure and troubleshoot VoIP phone systems, including RingCentral, 8x8, 3CX, and Nextiva.

Perform system upgrades, patches, and maintenance tasks.

Provide technical support and assistance to clients, both remotely and on-site.

Collaborate with clients to understand their telecommunication needs and recommend solutions.

Assist in the training of end-users on telecommunication systems.

Keep up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in telecommunications.

Qualifications:



Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in telecommunications.

Proficiency in legacy phone systems such as Nortel, Avaya, and NEC EC.

Strong knowledge of UCaaS solutions and VoIP phone systems, including RingCentral, 8x8, 3CX, and Nextiva.

Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Previous experience with 8x8, RingCentral, Nextiva, or Dialpad is a strong plus.

Industry certifications (e.g., CCNA, CCNP, UCaaS certifications) are a bonus.



Why Join?



Competitive salary and benefits package.

Opportunities for professional growth and development.

Collaborative and supportive team environment.

Exposure to cutting-edge telecommunications technologies.

Chance to work with a diverse range of clients and industries.

Employee recognition and appreciation programs.

If you are a dedicated Telecommunications Phone System Technician with experince in legacy systems and modern UCaaS/VoIP solutions, we encourage you to apply. Join our team and help us shape the future of business communication.

DON'T SEND ME GPT WORK! 99% of the applications are gpt work of the same script. Think differently, and you'll have a safe job for years.



This is a long-term project. If I see potential in you, I will teach you how to use AI to be faster.



Did you add RELEVANT samples? (if not, don't apply)



The rate will be negotiable based on your experience.



.....................

What's your favorite movie?

title: SEO and Lead Generation Specialist
description:
About Us



The Luxury Turnover is a rapidly growing New Zealand-based airbnb cleaning company. We partner with property managers, Airbnb hosts, and premium properties, and we’re expanding into new regions.



We’re looking for a results-driven SEO & Lead Generation Specialist to help us increase online visibility, capture qualified leads, and support business growth.



The Role



This role is focused on driving measurable growth through search visibility, lead capture systems, and proactive outreach. You’ll work closely with the founder and have clear performance goals and ownership of your work.



 Key Responsibilities



SEO & Website Optimisation



• Conduct keyword research and competitor analysis

• Optimise website pages for SEO (on-page SEO)

• Improve Google rankings and local search visibility

• Implement technical SEO improvements (where applicable)

• Monitor performance using analytics tools



Lead Capture & Conversion



• Create and optimise lead capture funnels

• Set up forms, landing pages, and CTAs

• Improve website conversion rates

• Manage and maintain CRM or lead tracking system



Cold Outreach &

• Research potential clients (property managers, hosts, businesses)

• Execute
 and LinkedIn outreach campaigns

• Maintain outreach lists and track responses

• Assist with follow-up sequences



Separately Paid Project Work



In addition to the weekly hours, there will be a few paid project opportunities such as:



• Building the company website and optimizing it 

• Creating landing pages for new campaigns

Suggesting and Implementing AI systems to our workflows



These projects will be paid separately outside the regular weekly hours.



Requirements



- Proven experience in SEO and lead generation

- Strong written English and communication skills

- Experience with keyword research tools

- Understanding of conversion optimisation

- Experience with outreach or prospecting

- Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

- Reliable internet connection



Preferred (but not essential):



- Experience working with service-based businesses

- Knowledge of local SEO

- Experience with CRM or automation tools



What Success Looks Like



- Increased website traffic

- Improved search rankings

- Consistent flow of qualified leads

- Effective outreach campaigns generating responses



Why Join Us?



• Long-term role with growth opportunities

• Flexible remote work

• Work directly with a fast-growing company

• Opportunity to take ownership of growth initiatives

• Potential to expand into a full-time role



How to Apply



Please send:



1?? Your CV

2?? Examples of SEO or lead generation work

3?? A short introduction video (1–2 minutes)

4?? Your expected hourly rate

5?? The word “Growth” at the top of your application



We’re looking for someone analytical, proactive, and results-focused who wants to grow with the business.



Applications reviewed on a rolling basis.

title: Amazon PPC Manager
description:
Urgent Hiring: Amazon PPC Manager

Reports To: CEO / Amazon Optimization Manager

Work Hours: Philippines Daytime Work Hours



ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.



Company Vision

We want to work with you to grow our company while helping you to become a superstar in your field. We value problem solvers, go-getters, and people with opinions who want to make an impact. You will be on the leading edge of Amazon and online strategies, continually improving your knowledge in the pursuit of helping us grow our business.



At the same time, you will be working with a company that values community & family—both internally and customer-facing. Our mission is to delight kids & parents with creative craft kits and related products. We are 100% focused on that mission and want you to be there on the ride with us!



That’s where you come in as our next Amazon PPC Manager.



Role Purpose

The Amazon PPC Manager owns the performance of all paid advertising on Amazon across our catalog. This person leads the strategy, execution, and optimization of all Sponsored Product, Sponsored Brand, and Sponsored Display campaigns to drive discoverability, revenue growth, and profitable scaling.



You will leverage Scale Insights daily—using advanced features like automation flows, keyword scoring, search term mining, and campaign-level rule logic—to drive high-impact decisions. Your ability to move beyond manual optimization and harness automation for scale is critical to success in this role.



What Success Looks Like

You consistently drive performance improvements using both manual and automated techniques, with Scale Insights as your core control panel. You own automation flows that intelligently adjust bids, pause underperforming targets, surface search term goldmines, and scale winners. You don’t just use Scale Insights—you master it.



You maintain a proactive and adaptive PPC strategy aligned with the catalog lifecycle, launch timing, and seasonality. Through frequent reporting, experimentation, and coordination with SEO, creative, and ops, you ensure campaigns support profitable, long-term growth.



Primary Objectives

Maximize profitable growth through advanced automation using Scale Insights

Own and optimize campaign architecture to drive ROI across all product stages

Partner cross-functionally for ad-aligned launches, creatives, and keyword strategy

Test, measure, and iterate to continuously improve CTR, CVR, and ROAS



Regular Work Activities

Monitor and refine SP/SB/SD campaigns daily through Scale Insights dashboards

Execute bid adjustments, search term mining, negative pruning

Build and optimize automation rules and flows in Scale Insights

Audit underperforming ad groups and apply automated corrective logic

Set up rule-based triggers for seasonal budget shifts and event-based bidding

Conduct A/B testing for headlines, images, placements

Weekly reporting with commentary using Scale Insights and custom dashboards

Work with SEO to align ad keyword targeting with organic ranking efforts

Collaborate with creative to ensure ad assets match campaign goals

Track budget utilization and reallocate funds based on real-time data

Maintain documentation and SOPs for all Scale Insights workflows

Guide PPC Assistants on implementing and QA’ing automation rules

Troubleshoot disapproved or underperforming ads

Flag inventory and pricing concerns affecting campaign viability

Maintain performance calendars for launches, promos, seasonality



Key Skills

Advanced knowledge of Scale Insights (automation, keyword scoring, flows)

Deep understanding of Amazon Ads (SP, SB, SD)

Strategic and analytical mindset with strong Excel/Google Sheets skills

Mastery in keyword match types, campaign structure, and budget management

Proven record of improving CTR, CVR, and ROAS

Excellent reporting and data storytelling skills

Detail-oriented with strong project tracking ability

Comfortable owning results, fixing issues, and moving fast

Strong communication across SEO, creative, and leadership teams

Passionate about learning and applying new ad techniques



People Contacts and Interactions

SEO Manager: Weekly coordination for keyword and ranking overlap

Creative Team: Weekly/as needed for ad assets, testing needs

Operations: Weekly or ad-hoc for stock, pricing, launch strategy

CEO / Leadership: Weekly/monthly reporting, performance reviews



Role Requirements

3+ years managing Amazon PPC campaigns

Experience using Scale Insights (must demonstrate real automation flow use cases, not just dashboards)

Proven success managing TACoS, ACOS, ROAS in high-SKU environments

Experience launching campaigns for new products and scaling mature ones

High proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Familiarity with keyword research, ranking tools, and performance reporting

Experience with automation strategy, not just manual optimization

Self-starter with high personal accountability and ownership

Bonus: Experience in creative ad testing and headline writing



How to Apply:

Click the link - 
/o/JB-7HSMY4Q39/landing

ONLY APPLICANTS WHO WILL APPLY THROUGH THE LINK WILL BE ENTERTAINED.

title: Experienced Home Improvement / Construction/ Remodeling Cold Caller (Appointment Setter)
description:
We’re hiring a hungry, creative, experienced cold caller to set quality in-home estimate appointments for U.S. homeowners.



This is not a “read a script and hope” role — we’re looking for someone who can think fast, handle objections, and fight for the appointment without sounding pushy or robotic.



What you’ll do

• Cold call homeowners from our provided lists

• Qualify the lead and set solid, real appointments

• Log call outcome + notes clearly

• Follow up with leads when needed



Pay

• $4-6/hour

• $5 bonus per qualified appointment (must be real + confirmed)

• $50 bonus per closed sale (paid when the deal closes)



What we’re looking for

• Proven cold-calling experience (required)

• Experience in home improvement or any construction (Required)

• Sales experience is a big plus

• Strong English + confident phone presence

• Reliable internet + quiet workspace

• Coachable, consistent, and competitive mindset



Schedule

• Full-time: 9AM–5PM PST



Important (please read):



If you don’t have real cold-calling experience, don’t have home improvement / construction-related experience, can’t work 9–5 PST, or aren’t comfortable sending a short voice sample later in the process, please don’t apply. This role is performance-based and we’re only moving forward with experienced callers — so we don’t waste your time or ours.
